Title: A1C
Condensed Summary: A1C is a blood test for type 2 diabetes and prediabetes. It measures your average blood glucose, or blood sugar, level over the past 3 months.

Title: Abdominal Pain
Condensed Summary: Your abdomen extends from below your chest to your groin. Some people call it the stomach, but your abdomen contains many other important organs.

Title: Abortion
Condensed Summary: An abortion is a procedure to end a pregnancy. It can be done two different ways: Medication abortion, which uses medicines to end the pregnancy.

Title: Abscess
Condensed Summary: An abscess is a pocket of pus. You can get an abscess almost anywhere in your body.

Title: Acne
Condensed Summary: Acne is a common skin disease that causes pimples. Pimples form when hair follicles under your skin clog up.

Title: Acoustic Neuroma
Also Called: Acoustic neurilemmoma, Acoustic neurinoma, Auditory tumor, Vestibular schwannoma
Condensed Summary: An acoustic neuroma is a benign tumor that develops on the nerve that connects the ear to the brain. The tumor usually grows slowly.

Title: Acupuncture
Condensed Summary: Acupuncture has been practiced in China and other Asian countries for thousands of years. Acupuncture involves stimulating specific points on the body.

Title: Acute Bronchitis
Condensed Summary: Bronchitis is an inflammation of the bronchial tubes, the airways that carry air to your lungs. It causes a cough that often brings up mucus.

Title: Acute Flaccid Myelitis
Condensed Summary: What is acute flaccid myelitis (AFM)? Acute flaccid myelitis (AFM) is a neurologic disease.

Title: Acute Lymphocytic Leukemia
Condensed Summary: What is leukemia? Leukemia is a term for cancers of the blood cells.

Title: Acute Myeloid Leukemia
Condensed Summary: What is leukemia? Leukemia is a term for cancers of the blood cells.

Title: Addison Disease
Condensed Summary: Your adrenal glands are just above your kidneys. The outside layer of these glands makes hormones that help your body respond to stress and regulate your blood pressure and water and salt balance.

Title: Adenoids
Condensed Summary: What are adenoids? Adenoids are a patch of tissue that is high up in the throat, just behind the nose.

Title: Adhesions
Condensed Summary: Adhesions are bands of scar-like tissue. Normally, internal tissues and organs have slippery surfaces so they can shift easily as the body moves.

Title: Adrenal Gland Cancer
Condensed Summary: Your adrenal, or suprarenal, glands are located on the top of each kidney. These glands produce hormones that you can't live without, including sex hormones and cortisol, which helps you respond to stress and has many other functions.

Title: Adrenal Gland Disorders
Condensed Summary: What are adrenal glands? Your adrenal glands are two small organs that sit on top of each kidney.

Title: After Surgery
Condensed Summary: After any operation, you'll have some side effects. There is usually some pain with surgery.
Physician: Orthopedic Surgery, Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Title: Air Pollution
Condensed Summary: Air pollution is a mixture of solid particles and gases in the air. Car emissions, chemicals from factories, dust, pollen and mold spores may be suspended as particles.

Title: Alcohol
Condensed Summary: If you are like many Americans, you drink alcohol at least occasionally. For many people, moderate drinking is probably safe.

Title: Alcohol Use Disorder (AUD)
Condensed Summary: What is alcohol use disorder (AUD)? For most adults, moderate alcohol use is probably not harmful.

Title: Alcohol Use Disorder (AUD) Treatment
Condensed Summary: What is an alcohol use disorder? An alcohol use disorder (AUD) is drinking that causes distress and harm.

Title: Allergy
Condensed Summary: An allergy is a reaction by your immune system to something that does not bother most other people. People who have allergies often are sensitive to more than one thing.

Title: Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency
Condensed Summary: What is alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency (AAT deficiency)? Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency (AAT deficiency, or AATD) is an inherited condition that raises your risk for lung and liver disease.

Title: Alzheimer's Caregivers
Condensed Summary: A caregiver gives care to someone who needs help taking care of themselves. It can be rewarding.

Title: Alzheimer's Disease
Condensed Summary: Alzheimer's disease (AD) is the most common form of dementia among older people. Dementia is a brain disorder that seriously affects a person's ability to carry out daily activities.

Title: Amblyopia
Condensed Summary: Amblyopia, or "lazy eye," is the most common cause of visual impairment in children. It happens when an eye fails to work properly with the brain.

Title: American Indian and Alaska Native Health
Also Called: Alaska Native health, American Indian health
Condensed Summary: Every racial or ethnic group has specific health concerns. Differences in the health of groups can result from: Genetics Environmental factors Access to care Cultural factors On this page, you'll find links to health issues that affect American Indians and Alaska Natives.

Title: Amino Acid Metabolism Disorders
Condensed Summary: Metabolism is the process your body uses to make energy from the food you eat. Food is made up of proteins, carbohydrates, and fats.

Title: Amyloidosis
Condensed Summary: Amyloidosis occurs when abnormal proteins called amyloids build up and form deposits. The deposits can collect in organs such as the kidney and heart.

Title: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis
Condensed Summary: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) is a nervous system disease that attacks nerve cells called neurons in your brain and spinal cord. These neurons transmit messages from your brain and spinal cord to your voluntary muscles - the ones you can control, like in your arms and legs.

Title: Anabolic Steroids
Condensed Summary: What are anabolic steroids? Anabolic steroids are synthetic (man-made) versions of testosterone.

Title: Anal Cancer
Condensed Summary: The anus is where stool leaves your body when you go to the bathroom. It is made up of your outer layers of skin and the end of your large intestine.

Title: Anal Disorders
Condensed Summary: The anus is the opening of the rectum through which stool passes out of your body. Problems with the anus are common.

Title: Anaphylaxis
Condensed Summary: Anaphylaxis is a serious allergic reaction. It can begin very quickly, and symptoms may be life-threatening.

Title: Anatomy
Condensed Summary: Anatomy is the science that studies the structure of the body. On this page, you'll find links to descriptions and pictures of the human body's parts and organ systems from head to toe.

Title: Anemia
Condensed Summary: If you have anemia, your blood does not carry enough oxygen to the rest of your body. The most common cause of anemia is not having enough iron.

Title: Anesthesia
Condensed Summary: What is anesthesia? Anesthesia is the use of medicines to prevent pain during surgery and other procedures.
Physician: Orthopedic Surgery, Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Title: Aneurysms
Condensed Summary: An aneurysm is a bulge or "ballooning" in the wall of an artery. Arteries are blood vessels that carry oxygen-rich blood from the heart to other parts of the body.

Title: Angina
Condensed Summary: Angina is chest pain or discomfort you feel when there is not enough blood flow to your heart muscle. Your heart muscle needs the oxygen that the blood carries.

Title: Angioplasty
Also Called: Balloon angioplasty, Coronary angioplasty, Percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI)
Condensed Summary: What is angioplasty? Angioplasty is a procedure to improve blood flow in coronary arteries that have become narrow or blocked.

Title: Animal Bites
Condensed Summary: Wild animals usually avoid people. They might attack, however, if they feel threatened, are sick, or are protecting their young or territory.

Title: Animal Diseases and Your Health
Condensed Summary: Animal diseases that people can catch are called zoonoses. Many diseases affecting humans can be traced to animals or animal products.

Title: Ankle Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your ankle bone and the ends of your two lower leg bones make up the ankle joint. Your ligaments, which connect bones to one another, stabilize and support it.

Title: Ankylosing Spondylitis
Condensed Summary: Ankylosing spondylitis is a type of arthritis of the spine. It causes inflammation between your vertebrae, which are the bones that make up your spine, and in the joints between your spine and pelvis.

Title: Anthrax
Condensed Summary: Anthrax is a disease caused by Bacillus anthracis, a germ that lives in soil. Many people know about it from the 2001 bioterror attacks.

Title: Antibiotic Resistance
Condensed Summary: Antibiotics are medicines that fight bacterial infections. Used properly, they can save lives.

Title: Antibiotics
Condensed Summary: What are antibiotics? Antibiotics are medicines that fight bacterial infections in people and animals.

Title: Antidepressants
Also Called: SSRIs, Selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, Tricyclic antidepressants
Condensed Summary: What are antidepressants? Antidepressants are prescription medicines to treat depression.

Title: Anxiety
Condensed Summary: What is anxiety? Anxiety is a feeling of fear, dread, and uneasiness.

Title: Aortic Aneurysm
Condensed Summary: An aneurysm is a bulge or "ballooning" in the wall of an artery. Arteries are blood vessels that carry oxygen-rich blood from the heart to other parts of the body.

Title: Aphasia
Condensed Summary: What is aphasia? Aphasia is a language disorder that makes it hard for you to read, write, and say what you mean to say.

Title: Aplastic Anemia
Condensed Summary: What is aplastic anemia? Aplastic anemia is a rare but serious blood disorder.

Title: Appendicitis
Condensed Summary: The appendix is a small, tube-like organ attached to the first part of the large intestine. It is located in the lower right part of the abdomen.

Title: Arm Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Of the 206 bones in your body, three of them are in your arm: the humerus, radius, and ulna. Your arms are also made up of muscles, joints, tendons, and other connective tissue.

Title: Arrhythmia
Condensed Summary: An arrhythmia is a problem with the rate or rhythm of your heartbeat. It means that your heart beats too quickly, too slowly, or with an irregular pattern.

Title: Arsenic
Condensed Summary: Arsenic is a natural element found in soil and minerals. Arsenic compounds are used to preserve wood, as pesticides, and in some industries.

Title: Arteriovenous Malformations
Condensed Summary: Arteriovenous malformations (AVMs) are defects in your vascular system. Your vascular system is your body's network of blood vessels.

Title: Arthritis
Condensed Summary: If you feel pain and stiffness in your body or have trouble moving around, you might have arthritis. Most kinds of arthritis cause pain and swelling in your joints.

Title: Artificial Limbs
Condensed Summary: People can lose all or part of an arm or leg for a number of reasons. Common ones include: Circulation problems from atherosclerosis or diabetes.
Physician: Orthopedic Surgery, Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Title: Asbestos
Condensed Summary: Asbestos is the name of a group of minerals with long, thin fibers. It was once used widely as insulation.

Title: Asian American Health
Condensed Summary: Every racial or ethnic group has specific health concerns. Differences in the health of groups can result from: Genetics Environmental factors Access to care Cultural factors On this page, you'll find links to health issues that affect Asian Americans.

Title: Aspergillosis
Condensed Summary: Aspergillosis is a disease caused by a fungus (or mold) called Aspergillus. The fungus is very common in both indoors and outdoors.

Title: Assisted Living
Condensed Summary: Assisted living is housing and services for people who need some help with daily care. They may need help with things like dressing, bathing, taking their medicines, and cleaning.

Title: Assisted Reproductive Technology
Condensed Summary: Assisted reproductive technology (ART) is used to treat infertility. It includes fertility treatments that handle both eggs and sperm.

Title: Assistive Devices
Condensed Summary: If you have a disability or injury, you may use a number of assistive devices. These are tools, products or types of equipment that help you perform tasks and activities.
Physician: Orthopedic Surgery, Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Title: Asthma
Condensed Summary: What is asthma? Asthma is a chronic (long-term) lung disease.

Title: Asthma in Children
Condensed Summary: What is asthma? Asthma is a chronic (long-term) lung disease.

Title: Ataxia Telangiectasia
Condensed Summary: Ataxia-telangiectasia (A-T) is a rare, inherited disease. It affects the nervous system, immune system, and other body systems.

Title: Atherosclerosis
Condensed Summary: Atherosclerosis is a disease in which plaque builds up inside your arteries. Plaque is a sticky substance made up of fat, cholesterol, calcium, and other substances found in the blood.

Title: Athlete's Foot
Condensed Summary: Athlete's foot is a common infection caused by a fungus. It most often affects the space between the toes.

Title: Atrial Fibrillation
Condensed Summary: What is atrial fibrillation (AFib)? Atrial fibrillation, also known as AFib or AF, is one of the most common types of arrhythmias.

Title: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder
Condensed Summary: Is it hard for your child to sit still? Does your child act without thinking first?

Title: Autism Spectrum Disorder
Condensed Summary: Autism spectrum disorder (ASD) is a neurological and developmental disorder that begins early in childhood and lasts throughout a person's life. It affects how a person acts and interacts with others, communicates, and learns.

Title: Autoimmune Diseases
Condensed Summary: What are autoimmune diseases? Your immune system protects you from disease and infection by attacking germs that get into your body, such as viruses and bacteria.

Title: Autonomic Nervous System Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your autonomic nervous system is the part of your nervous system that controls involuntary actions, such as the beating of your heart and the widening or narrowing of your blood vessels. When something goes wrong in this system, it can cause serious problems, including: Blood pressure problems Heart problems Trouble with breathing and swallowing Erectile dysfunction in men Autonomic nervous system disorders can occur alone or as the result of another disease, such as Parkinson's disease, alcoholism and diabetes.

Title: Baby Health Checkup
Condensed Summary: There are many new responsibilities when you have a baby. One of them is to make sure that your baby gets regular checkups, which are called well-baby exams.

Title: Back Injuries
Condensed Summary: Your back is made of bones, muscles, and other tissues extending from your neck to your pelvis. Back injuries can result from sports injuries, work around the house or in the garden, or a sudden jolt such as a car accident.

Title: Back Pain
Condensed Summary: If you've ever groaned, "Oh, my aching back!", you are not alone. Back pain is one of the most common medical problems, affecting 8 out of 10 people at some point during their lives.

Title: Bacterial Infections
Condensed Summary: Bacteria are living things that have only one cell. Under a microscope, they look like balls, rods, or spirals.

Title: Bad Breath
Condensed Summary: There are many reasons why you might have bad breath. You can get it if you don't brush and floss regularly.

Title: Balance Problems
Condensed Summary: Have you ever felt dizzy, lightheaded, or as if the room is spinning around you? If the feeling happens often, it could be a sign of a balance problem.

Title: Barotrauma
Condensed Summary: Barotrauma means injury to your body because of changes in barometric (air) or water pressure. One common type happens to your ear.

Title: Bed Bugs
Condensed Summary: Bed bugs bite you and feed on your blood. You may have no reaction to the bites, or you may have small marks or itching.

Title: Behcet's Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Behcet's syndrome is a disease that involves vasculitis, which is inflammation of the blood vessels. It causes problems in many parts of the body.

Title: Bell's Palsy
Condensed Summary: Bell's palsy is the most common cause of facial paralysis. It usually affects just one side of the face.

Title: Benign Tumors
Condensed Summary: Tumors are abnormal growths in your body. They can be either benign or malignant.

Title: Bereavement
Condensed Summary: Bereavement is the period of grief and mourning after a death. When you grieve, it's part of the normal process of reacting to a loss.

Title: Bile Duct Cancer
Condensed Summary: Your liver makes a digestive juice called bile. Your gallbladder stores it between meals.

Title: Bile Duct Diseases
Condensed Summary: Your liver makes a digestive juice called bile. Your gallbladder stores it between meals.

Title: Biodefense and Bioterrorism
Condensed Summary: A bioterrorism attack is the deliberate release of viruses, bacteria, or other germs to cause illness or death. These germs are often found in nature.

Title: Biopsy
Condensed Summary: A biopsy is a procedure that removes cells or tissue from your body. A doctor called a pathologist looks at the cells or tissue under a microscope to check for damage or disease.

Title: Bipolar Disorder
Condensed Summary: What is bipolar disorder? Bipolar disorder is a mood disorder that can cause intense mood swings: Sometimes you may feel extremely "up," elated, irritable, or energized.

Title: Bird Flu
Also Called: Avian flu, Avian influenza, H5N1, H7N9
Condensed Summary: Birds, just like people, get the flu. Bird flu viruses infect birds, including chickens, other poultry, and wild birds such as ducks.

Title: Birth Control
Condensed Summary: What is birth control? Birth control, also known as contraception, is the use of medicines, devices, or surgery to prevent pregnancy.

Title: Birth Defects
Condensed Summary: What are birth defects? A birth defect is a problem that happens while a baby is developing in the mother's body.

Title: Birth Weight
Condensed Summary: What is birth weight? Birth weight is the first weight of your baby, taken just after being born.

Title: Birthmarks
Also Called: Cafe au lait spot, Hemangioma, Mongolian spot, Nevus, Strawberry mark
Condensed Summary: Birthmarks are abnormalities of the skin that are present when a baby is born. There are two types of birthmarks.

Title: Black and African American Health
Condensed Summary: Every racial or ethnic group has specific health concerns. Differences in the health of groups can result from: Genetics Environmental factors Access to care Cultural factors On this page, you'll find links to health issues that affect Black and African Americans.

Title: Bladder Cancer
Condensed Summary: The bladder is a hollow organ in your lower abdomen that stores urine. Bladder cancer occurs in the lining of the bladder.

Title: Bladder Diseases
Condensed Summary: The bladder is a hollow organ in your lower abdomen that stores urine. Many conditions can affect your bladder.

Title: Bleeding
Condensed Summary: Bleeding is the loss of blood. It can be external, or outside the body, like when you get a cut or wound.

Title: Bleeding Disorders
Condensed Summary: Normally, if you get hurt, your body forms a blood clot to stop the bleeding. For blood to clot, your body needs cells called platelets and proteins known as clotting factors.

Title: Blisters
Condensed Summary: What are blisters? Blisters are fluid-filled sacs on the outer layer of your skin.

Title: Blood
Condensed Summary: Your blood is made up of liquid and solids. The liquid part, called plasma, is made of water, salts, and protein.

Title: Blood Clots
Condensed Summary: What is a blood clot? A blood clot is mass of blood that forms when platelets, proteins, and cells in the blood stick together.

Title: Blood Count Tests
Also Called: CBC, Complete Blood Count, Hematologic Tests
Condensed Summary: Your blood contains red blood cells (RBC), white blood cells (WBC), and platelets. Blood count tests measure the number and types of cells in your blood.

Title: Blood Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your blood is living tissue made up of liquid and solids. The liquid part, called plasma, is made of water, salts and protein.

Title: Blood Glucose
Condensed Summary: What is blood glucose? Blood glucose, or blood sugar, is the main sugar found in your blood.

Title: Blood Pressure Medicines
Also Called: Antihypertensive medicines, High blood pressure medicines
Condensed Summary: What is high blood pressure? High blood pressure, also called hypertension, is when blood puts too much pressure against the walls of your arteries.

Title: Blood Thinners
Condensed Summary: What are blood thinners? Blood thinners are medicines that prevent blood clots from forming.

Title: Blood Transfusion and Donation
Condensed Summary: Every year, millions of people in the United States receive life-saving blood transfusions. During a transfusion, you receive whole blood or parts of blood such as: Red blood cells - cells that carry oxygen to and from tissues and organs Platelets - cells that form clots to control bleeding Plasma - the liquid part of the blood that helps clotting.

Title: Body Lice
Condensed Summary: What are body lice? Body lice (also called clothes lice) are tiny insects which live and lay nits (lice eggs) on clothing.

Title: Body Weight
Condensed Summary: Do you know if your current weight is healthy? "Underweight", "normal", "overweight", and "obese" are all labels for ranges of weight.

Title: Bone Cancer
Condensed Summary: Cancer that starts in a bone is uncommon. Cancer that has spread to the bone from another part of the body is more common.

Title: Bone Density
Condensed Summary: Strong bones are important for your health. A bone mineral density (BMD) test is the best way to measure your bone health.

Title: Bone Diseases
Condensed Summary: Your bones help you move, give you shape and support your body. They are living tissues that rebuild constantly throughout your life.

Title: Bone Grafts
Condensed Summary: A bone graft transplants bone tissue. Surgeons use bone grafts to repair and rebuild diseased bones in your hips, knees, spine, and sometimes other bones and joints.

Title: Bone Infections
Condensed Summary: Like other parts of the body, bones can get infected. The infections are usually bacterial, but can also be fungal.

Title: Bone Marrow Diseases
Condensed Summary: Bone marrow is the spongy tissue inside some of your bones, such as your hip and thigh bones. It contains stem cells.

Title: Bone Marrow Transplantation
Condensed Summary: Bone marrow is the spongy tissue inside some of your bones, such as your hip and thigh bones. It contains immature cells, called stem cells.

Title: Botox
Condensed Summary: Botox is a drug made from a toxin produced by the bacterium Clostridium botulinum. It's the same toxin that causes a life-threatening type of food poisoning called botulism.

Title: Botulism
Condensed Summary: Botulism is a rare but serious illness. The cause is a toxin (poison) made by a bacterium called Clostridium botulinum.

Title: Bowel Incontinence
Condensed Summary: Bowel incontinence is the inability to control your bowels. When you feel the urge to have a bowel movement, you may not be able to hold it until you get to a toilet.

Title: Bowel Movement
Condensed Summary: A bowel movement is the last stop in the movement of food through your digestive tract. Your stool passes out of your body through the rectum and anus.

Title: Brachial Plexus Injuries
Condensed Summary: The brachial plexus is a network of nerves that sends signals from the spine to the shoulder, arm, and hand. Damage to the brachial plexus can cause symptoms such as: A limp or paralyzed arm Lack of muscle control in the arm, hand, or wrist Lack of feeling or sensation in the arm or hand Brachial plexus injuries can happen because of shoulder trauma, tumors, or inflammation.

Title: Brain Aneurysm
Also Called: Berry aneurysm, Cerebral aneurysm, Intracranial aneurysm
Condensed Summary: A brain aneurysm is an abnormal bulge or "ballooning" in the wall of an artery in the brain. They are sometimes called berry aneurysms because they are often the size of a small berry.

Title: Brain Diseases
Condensed Summary: Your brain is the control center of your body. It controls your thoughts, memory, speech, and movement.

Title: Brain Malformations
Condensed Summary: Most brain malformations begin long before a baby is born. Something damages the developing nervous system or causes it to develop abnormally.

Title: Brain Tumors
Condensed Summary: A brain tumor is a growth of abnormal cells in the tissues of the brain. Brain tumors can be benign, with no cancer cells, or malignant, with cancer cells that grow quickly.

Title: Breast Cancer
Condensed Summary: What is breast cancer? Breast cancer is a cancer that starts in breast tissue.

Title: Breast Diseases
Condensed Summary: Most women experience breast changes at some time. Your age, hormone levels, and medicines you take may cause lumps, bumps, and discharges (fluids that are not breast milk).

Title: Breast Reconstruction
Condensed Summary: If you need a mastectomy, you have a choice about whether or not to have surgery to rebuild the shape of the breast. Instead of breast reconstruction, you could choose to wear a breast form that replaces the breast, wear padding inside your bra, or do nothing.

Title: Breastfeeding
Condensed Summary: Breastfeeding offers many benefits to your baby. Breast milk contains the right balance of nutrients to help your infant grow into a strong and healthy toddler.

Title: Breathing Problems
Condensed Summary: When you're short of breath, it's hard or uncomfortable for you to take in the oxygen your body needs. You may feel as if you're not getting enough air.

Title: Bronchial Disorders
Condensed Summary: When you breathe in, the air travels down through your trachea (windpipe). It then goes through two tubes to your lungs.

Title: Bruises
Condensed Summary: A bruise is a mark on your skin caused by blood trapped under the surface. It happens when an injury crushes small blood vessels but does not break the skin.

Title: Bullying and Cyberbullying
Condensed Summary: What is bullying? Bullying is when a person or group repeatedly harms someone on purpose.

Title: Burns
Condensed Summary: A burn is damage to your body's tissues caused by heat, chemicals, electricity, sunlight, or radiation. Scalds from hot liquids and steam, building fires and flammable liquids and gases are the most common causes of burns.

Title: Bursitis
Condensed Summary: A bursa is a small, fluid-filled sac that acts as a cushion between a bone and other moving parts, such as muscles, tendons, or skin. Bursitis occurs when a bursa becomes inflamed.

Title: C. diff Infections
Also Called: Clostridioides difficile infections, Clostridium difficile Infections, Clostridium enterocolitis, Pseudomembranous colitis
Condensed Summary: What is C. diff? C. diff is a bacterium that can cause diarrhea and more serious intestinal conditions such as colitis.

Title: Calcium
Condensed Summary: You have more calcium in your body than any other mineral. Calcium has many important jobs.

Title: Campylobacter Infections
Condensed Summary: Campylobacter infection is a common foodborne illness. You usually get it from eating contaminated food, especially raw or undercooked poultry.

Title: Cancer
Condensed Summary: Cancer begins in your cells, which are the building blocks of your body. Normally, your body forms new cells as you need them, replacing old cells that die.

Title: Cancer Alternative Therapies
Condensed Summary: You have many choices to make about your cancer treatment. One choice you might be thinking about is complementary and alternative medicine (CAM).

Title: Cancer Chemotherapy
Condensed Summary: What is cancer chemotherapy? Cancer chemotherapy is a type of cancer treatment.

Title: Cancer Immunotherapy
Condensed Summary: Immunotherapy is a cancer treatment that helps your immune system fight cancer. It is a type of biological therapy.

Title: Cancer in Children
Condensed Summary: Cancer is a group of related diseases. In all types of cancer, some of the body's cells begin to divide without stopping and spread into surrounding tissues.

Title: Cancer--Living with Cancer
Condensed Summary: Learning to live with cancer Cancer is a common disease. Almost 40 percent of Americans will be diagnosed with cancer during their lifetimes.

Title: Canker Sores
Condensed Summary: Canker sores are small, round sores in your mouth. They can be on the inside of your cheek, under your tongue, or in the back of your throat.

Title: Carbohydrate Metabolism Disorders
Condensed Summary: Metabolism is the process your body uses to make energy from the food you eat. Food is made up of proteins, carbohydrates, and fats.

Title: Carbon Monoxide Poisoning
Condensed Summary: Carbon monoxide (CO) is a gas that has no odor or color. But it is very dangerous.

Title: Carcinoid Tumors
Condensed Summary: Carcinoid tumors are rare, slow-growing cancers. They usually start in the lining of the digestive tract or in the lungs.

Title: Cardiac Rehabilitation
Condensed Summary: Cardiac rehabilitation (rehab) is a medically supervised program to help people who have: A heart attack Angioplasty or coronary artery bypass grafting for coronary heart disease A heart valve repair or replacement A heart transplant or a lung transplant Angina Heart failure The goal is to help you return to an active life, and to reduce the risk of further heart problems. A team of specialists will create a plan for you that includes exercise training, education on heart healthy living, and counseling to reduce stress.

Title: Cardiomyopathy
Also Called: Arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy, Dilated cardiomyopathy, Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, Myocardiopathy, Restrictive cardiomyopathy
Condensed Summary: Cardiomyopathy is the name for diseases of the heart muscle. These diseases enlarge your heart muscle or make it thicker and more rigid than normal.

Title: Carotid Artery Disease
Condensed Summary: Your carotid arteries are two large blood vessels in your neck. They supply your brain and head with blood.

Title: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
Condensed Summary: What is carpal tunnel syndrome? Carpal tunnel syndrome is the name for a group of problems that includes numbness, tingling, weakness, or pain in your wrist or hand.

Title: Cartilage Disorders
Condensed Summary: Cartilage is the tough but flexible tissue that covers the ends of your bones at a joint. It also gives shape and support to other parts of your body, such as your ears, nose and windpipe.

Title: Cat Scratch Disease
Condensed Summary: Cat scratch disease (CSD) is an illness caused by the bacterium Bartonella henselae. Almost half of all cats carry the infection at some point.

Title: Cataract
Condensed Summary: A cataract is a clouding of the lens in your eye. It affects your vision.

Title: Celiac Disease
Also Called: Celiac sprue, Gluten-sensitive enteropathy, Nontropical sprue
Condensed Summary: What is celiac disease? Celiac disease is a chronic (long-term) digestive and immune disorder that damages your small intestine.

Title: Cellulitis
Condensed Summary: Cellulitis is an infection of the skin and deep underlying tissues. Group A strep (streptococcal) bacteria are the most common cause.

Title: Cerebellar Disorders
Condensed Summary: When you play the piano or hit a tennis ball you are activating the cerebellum. The cerebellum is the area of the brain that controls coordination and balance.

Title: Cerebral Palsy
Condensed Summary: What is cerebral palsy (CP)? Cerebral palsy (CP) is a group of disorders that cause problems with movement, balance, and posture.

Title: Cervical Cancer
Condensed Summary: The cervix is the lower part of the uterus, the place where a baby grows during pregnancy. Cervical cancer is caused by a virus called HPV.

Title: Cervical Cancer Screening
Condensed Summary: The cervix is the lower part of the uterus, the place where a baby grows during pregnancy. Cancer screening is looking for cancer before you have any symptoms.

Title: Cervix Disorders
Condensed Summary: The cervix is the lower part of the uterus, the place where a baby grows during pregnancy. The cervix has a small opening that expands during childbirth.

Title: Cesarean Delivery
Condensed Summary: What is a cesarean delivery? A cesarean delivery, also called a cesarean section or c-section, is surgery to deliver a baby.

Title: Chagas Disease
Condensed Summary: What is Chagas disease? Chagas disease, or American trypanosomiasis, is an illness that can cause serious heart and stomach problems.

Title: Charcot-Marie-Tooth Disease
Also Called: Hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy, Peroneal muscular atrophy
Condensed Summary: Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease (CMT) is a group of genetic nerve disorders. It is named after the three doctors who first identified it.

Title: Chest Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: What is the chest? The chest is the part of your body between your neck and your abdomen (belly).

Title: Chest Pain
Condensed Summary: Having a pain in your chest can be scary. It does not always mean that you are having a heart attack.

Title: Chiari Malformation
Condensed Summary: Chiari malformations (CMs) are structural defects in the cerebellum. The cerebellum is the part of the brain that controls balance.

Title: Chickenpox
Condensed Summary: Chickenpox is an infection caused by the varicella-zoster virus. Most cases are in children under age 15, but older children and adults can get it.

Title: Chikungunya
Condensed Summary: Chikungunya is a virus that spread by the same kinds of mosquitoes that spread dengue and Zika virus. Rarely, it can spread from mother to newborn around the time of birth.

Title: Child Abuse
Condensed Summary: Child abuse is doing something or failing to do something that results in harm to a child or puts a child at risk of harm. Child abuse can be physical, sexual or emotional.

Title: Child Behavior Disorders
Condensed Summary: All kids misbehave some times. And some may have temporary behavior problems due to stress.

Title: Child Dental Health
Condensed Summary: Healthy teeth are important to your child's overall health. From the time your child is born, there are things you can do to promote healthy teeth and prevent cavities.

Title: Child Development
Condensed Summary: As children grow older, they develop in several different ways. Child development includes physical, intellectual, social, and emotional changes.

Title: Child Mental Health
Condensed Summary: It's important to recognize and treat mental illnesses in children early on. Once mental illness develops, it becomes a regular part of your child's behavior.

Title: Child Nutrition
Condensed Summary: A healthy diet helps children grow and learn. It also helps prevent obesity and weight-related diseases, such as diabetes.

Title: Child Safety
Condensed Summary: As parents, we want to keep our children safe from harm. Take steps to keep your children safe: Install the right child safety seat in your car Teach children how to cross the street safely Make sure they wear the right gear and equipment for sports Install and test smoke alarms Store medicines, cleaners and other dangerous substances in locked cabinets Babyproof your home Don't leave small children unattended

Title: Child Sexual Abuse
Condensed Summary: Sexual abuse is one form of child abuse. It includes a wide range of actions between a child and an adult or older child.

Title: Childbirth
Condensed Summary: When you are ready to have your baby, you'll go through labor. Labor is the process of giving birth.

Title: Childbirth Problems
Condensed Summary: Childbirth is the process of giving birth to a baby. It includes labor and delivery.

Title: Childhood Brain Tumors
Condensed Summary: Brain tumors are abnormal growths inside the skull. They are among the most common types of childhood cancers.

Title: Childhood Leukemia
Condensed Summary: What is leukemia? Leukemia is a term for cancers of the blood cells.

Title: Childhood Vaccines
Condensed Summary: What are vaccines? Vaccines are injections (shots), liquids, pills, or nasal sprays that you take to teach the immune system to recognize and defend against harmful germs.

Title: Children's Health
Condensed Summary: Your child's health includes physical, mental and social well-being. Most parents know the basics of keeping children healthy, like offering them healthy foods, making sure they get enough sleep and exercise and insuring their safety.

Title: Chiropractic
Condensed Summary: Chiropractic is a health care profession. Chiropractors perform adjustments (manipulations) to the spine or other parts of the body.

Title: Chlamydia Infections
Condensed Summary: What is chlamydia? Chlamydia is a common sexually transmitted disease (STD).

Title: Choking
Condensed Summary: Food or small objects can cause choking if they get caught in your throat and block your airway. This keeps oxygen from getting to your lungs and brain.

Title: Cholera
Condensed Summary: Cholera is a bacterial infection that causes diarrhea. The cholera bacterium is usually found in water or food that has been contaminated by feces (poop).

Title: Cholesterol
Condensed Summary: What is cholesterol? Cholesterol is a waxy, fat-like substance that's found in all the cells in your body.

Title: Cholesterol Levels: What You Need to Know
Condensed Summary: What is cholesterol? Cholesterol is a waxy, fat-like substance that's found in all the cells in your body.

Title: Cholesterol Medicines
Condensed Summary: What is cholesterol? Your body needs some cholesterol to work properly.

Title: Chronic Bronchitis
Condensed Summary: What is chronic bronchitis? Chronic bronchitis is a type of COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease).

Title: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
Also Called: CFS, ME/CFS, Myalgic Encephalomyelitis, SEID, Systemic Exertion Intolerance Disease
Condensed Summary: What is chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS)? Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) is a serious, long-term illness that affects many body systems.

Title: Chronic Kidney Disease
Condensed Summary: You have two kidneys, each about the size of your fist. Their main job is to filter your blood.

Title: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
Condensed Summary: What is leukemia? Leukemia is a term for cancers of the blood cells.

Title: Chronic Myeloid Leukemia
Also Called: CML, Chronic granulocytic leukemia, Chronic myelogenous leukemia
Condensed Summary: What is leukemia? Leukemia is a term for cancers of the blood cells.

Title: Chronic Pain
Condensed Summary: Pain is a signal in your nervous system that something may be wrong. It is an unpleasant feeling, such as a prick, tingle, sting, burn, or ache.

Title: Circumcision
Condensed Summary: What is circumcision? Circumcision is a surgical procedure to remove the foreskin, the skin that covers the tip of the penis.

Title: Cirrhosis
Condensed Summary: Cirrhosis is scarring of the liver. Scar tissue forms because of injury or long-term disease.

Title: Cleaning, Disinfecting, and Sanitizing
Condensed Summary: Where are germs found? Germs are a part of everyday life.

Title: Cleft Lip and Palate
Condensed Summary: Cleft lip and cleft palate are birth defects that occur when a baby's lip or mouth do not form properly. They happen early during pregnancy.

Title: Climate Change
Condensed Summary: Climate is the average weather in a place over a period of time. Climate change is major change in temperature, rainfall, snow, or wind patterns lasting for many years.

Title: Cloning
Condensed Summary: Cloning describes the processes used to create an exact genetic replica of another cell, tissue or organism. The copied material, which has the same genetic makeup as the original, is referred to as a clone.

Title: Club Drugs
Condensed Summary: What are club drugs? Club drugs are group of psychoactive drugs.

Title: Cocaine
Also Called: Blow, C, Coca, Coke, Crack, Flake, Snow
Condensed Summary: Cocaine is a white powder. It can be snorted up the nose or mixed with water and injected with a needle.

Title: Cochlear Implants
Condensed Summary: A cochlear implant is a small, complex electronic device that can help to provide a sense of sound. People who are profoundly deaf or severely hard-of-hearing can get help from them.

Title: Cold and Cough Medicines
Condensed Summary: What are cold and cough medicines? Cold and cough medicines can help relieve symptoms of a common cold.

Title: Cold Sores
Condensed Summary: Cold sores are caused by a contagious virus called herpes simplex virus (HSV). There are two types of HSV.

Title: Collapsed Lung
Condensed Summary: A collapsed lung happens when air enters the pleural space, the area between the lung and the chest wall. If it is a total collapse, it is called pneumothorax.

Title: College Health
Condensed Summary: College life involves excitement, along with new challenges, risks, and responsibilities. You are meeting new people, learning new things, and making your own decisions.

Title: Colonic Diseases
Condensed Summary: Your colon, also known as the large intestine, is part of your digestive system. It's a long, hollow tube at the end of your digestive tract where your body makes and stores stool.

Title: Colonic Polyps
Condensed Summary: A polyp is an extra piece of tissue that grows inside your body. Colonic polyps grow in the large intestine, or colon.

Title: Colonoscopy
Condensed Summary: What are colonoscopy and flexible sigmoidoscopy? Colonoscopy and flexible sigmoidoscopy are procedures that let your doctor look inside your rectum and colon (large intestine).

Title: Color Blindness
Condensed Summary: Most of us see our world in color. We enjoy looking at a lush green lawn or a red rose in full bloom.

Title: Colorectal Cancer
Condensed Summary: What is colorectal cancer? Colorectal cancer is cancer that develops in the tissues of the colon or rectum.

Title: Coma
Condensed Summary: A coma is a deep state of unconsciousness. An individual in a coma is alive but unable to move or respond to his or her environment.

Title: Common Cold
Condensed Summary: What is the common cold? The common cold is a mild infection of your upper respiratory tract (which includes your nose and throat).

Title: Common Infant and Newborn Problems
Condensed Summary: It is hard when your baby is sick. Common health problems in babies include colds, coughs, fevers, and vomiting.

Title: Complementary and Integrative Medicine
Condensed Summary: Many Americans use medical treatments that are not part of mainstream medicine. When you are using these types of care, it may be called complementary, integrative, or alternative medicine.

Title: Complex Regional Pain Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS) is a chronic pain condition. It causes intense pain, usually in the arms, hands, legs, or feet.

Title: Compulsive Gambling
Condensed Summary: Many people enjoy gambling, whether it's betting on a horse or playing poker on the Internet. Most people who gamble don't have a problem, but some lose control of their gambling.

Title: Concussion
Condensed Summary: A concussion is a type of brain injury. It involves a short loss of normal brain function.

Title: Congenital Heart Defects
Condensed Summary: What are congenital heart defects? Congenital heart defects (CHDs) are problems with the structure of the heart.

Title: Connective Tissue Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your connective tissue supports many different parts of your body, such as your skin, eyes, and heart. It is like a "cellular glue" that gives your body parts their shape and helps keep them strong.

Title: Constipation
Condensed Summary: Constipation means that a person has three or fewer bowel movements in a week. The stool can be hard and dry.

Title: COPD
Condensed Summary: What is COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease)? COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease) is a group of lung diseases that make it hard to breathe and get worse over time.

Title: Coping with Chronic Illness
Condensed Summary: Having a long-term, or chronic, illness can disrupt your life in many ways. You may often be tired and in pain.

Title: Coping with Disasters
Condensed Summary: No matter how well you have prepared, you might feel dazed or numb after going through a disaster. You may also feel sad, helpless, or anxious.

Title: Corneal Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your cornea is the outermost layer of your eye. It is clear and shaped like a dome.

Title: Corns and Calluses
Condensed Summary: Corns and calluses are caused by pressure or friction on your skin. They often appear on feet where the bony parts of your feet rub against your shoes.

Title: Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery
Also Called: Bypass surgery, CABG, Coronary artery bypass graft
Condensed Summary: In coronary artery disease (CAD), the arteries that supply blood and oxygen to your heart muscle grow hardened and narrowed. You may try treatments such as lifestyle changes, medicines, and angioplasty, a procedure to open the arteries.

Title: Coronary Artery Disease
Also Called: CAD, Coronary arteriosclerosis, Coronary atherosclerosis, Coronary heart disease
Condensed Summary: Coronary artery disease (CAD) is the most common type of heart disease. It is the leading cause of death in the United States in both men and women.

Title: Cosmetics
Condensed Summary: Cosmetics are products you apply to your body to clean it, make it more attractive, or change the way it looks. They include: Hair dyes Makeup Perfumes Skin-care creams Cosmetics that treat or prevent diseases are also drugs.

Title: Cough
Condensed Summary: Coughing is a reflex that keeps your throat and airways clear. Although it can be annoying, coughing helps your body heal or protect itself.

Title: COVID-19 (Coronavirus Disease 2019)
Condensed Summary: COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019) is an illness caused by a virus. This virus is a coronavirus called SARS-CoV-2.

Title: COVID-19 Testing
Also Called: COVID-19 Antibody Test, COVID-19 Viral Test, SARS-CoV-2 Testing
Condensed Summary: COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019) is a disease caused by a virus called SARS-CoV-2. There are two types of tests for this virus: A viral test tells you if you have a current infection.

Title: COVID-19 Vaccines
Condensed Summary: COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019) is an illness caused by a virus. This virus is a coronavirus called SARS-CoV-2.

Title: CPR
Condensed Summary: When someone's blood flow or breathing stops, seconds count. Permanent brain damage or death can happen quickly.

Title: Craniofacial Abnormalities
Condensed Summary: Craniofacial is a medical term that relates to the bones of the skull and face. Craniofacial abnormalities are birth defects of the face or head.

Title: Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease
Condensed Summary: Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD) is a rare, degenerative brain disorder. Symptoms usually start around age 60.

Title: Critical Care
Condensed Summary: What is critical care? Critical care is medical care for people who have life-threatening injuries and illnesses.
Physician: Orthopedic Surgery, Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Title: Crohn's Disease
Condensed Summary: What is Crohn's disease? Crohn's disease is a chronic disease that causes inflammation in your digestive tract.

Title: Croup
Condensed Summary: Croup is an inflammation of the vocal cords (larynx) and windpipe (trachea). It causes difficulty breathing, a barking cough, and a hoarse voice.

Title: Cryptosporidiosis
Condensed Summary: Cryptosporidiosis (crypto) is an illness caused by a parasite. The parasite lives in soil, food, and water.

Title: CT Scans
Condensed Summary: Computed tomography (CT) is a type of imaging. It uses special x-ray equipment to make cross-sectional pictures of your body.

Title: Cushing's Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Cushing's syndrome is a hormonal disorder. The cause is long-term exposure to too much cortisol, a hormone that your adrenal gland makes.

Title: Cystic Fibrosis
Condensed Summary: Cystic fibrosis (CF) is an inherited disease of the mucus and sweat glands. It affects mostly your lungs, pancreas, liver, intestines, sinuses, and sex organs.

Title: Cytomegalovirus Infections
Condensed Summary: Cytomegalovirus (CMV) is a virus found around the world. It is related to the viruses that cause chickenpox and infectious mononucleosis (mono).

Title: Dandruff, Cradle Cap, and Other Scalp Conditions
Condensed Summary: Your scalp is the skin on the top of your head. Unless you have hair loss, hair grows on your scalp.

Title: DASH Eating Plan
Also Called: DASH Diet, Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension
Condensed Summary: DASH stands for Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension. It is an eating plan that is based on research studies sponsored by the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI).

Title: Deep Vein Thrombosis
Condensed Summary: Deep vein thrombosis, or DVT, is a blood clot that forms in a vein deep in the body. Most deep vein clots occur in the lower leg or thigh.

Title: Degenerative Nerve Diseases
Condensed Summary: Degenerative nerve diseases affect many of your body's activities, such as balance, movement, talking, breathing, and heart function. Many of these diseases are genetic.

Title: Dehydration
Condensed Summary: What is dehydration? Dehydration is a condition caused by the loss of too much fluid from the body.

Title: Delirium
Condensed Summary: What is delirium? Delirium is a mental state in which you are confused, disoriented, and not able to think or remember clearly.

Title: Dementia
Condensed Summary: What is dementia? Dementia is a loss of mental functions that is severe enough to affect your daily life and activities.

Title: Dengue
Condensed Summary: What is dengue? Dengue is a viral infection.

Title: Dental Health
Condensed Summary: It's important to take care of your mouth and teeth starting in childhood. If you don't, you could have problems with your teeth and gums - like cavities or even tooth loss.

Title: Dentures
Condensed Summary: Dentures are false teeth made to replace teeth you have lost. They can be complete or partial.

Title: Depression
Also Called: Clinical depression, Dysthymic disorder, Major depressive disorder, Unipolar depression
Condensed Summary: Depression is a serious medical illness. It's more than just a feeling of being sad or "blue" for a few days.

Title: Developmental Disabilities
Condensed Summary: Developmental disabilities are severe, long-term problems. They may be physical, such as blindness.

Title: Diabetes
Condensed Summary: Diabetes is a disease in which your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high. Glucose comes from the foods you eat.

Title: Diabetes and Pregnancy
Condensed Summary: Diabetes is a disease in which your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high. When you are pregnant, high blood sugar levels are not good for your baby.

Title: Diabetes Complications
Condensed Summary: What is diabetes? If you have diabetes, your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high.

Title: Diabetes in Children and Teens
Condensed Summary: Until recently, the common type of diabetes in children and teens was type 1. It was called juvenile diabetes.

Title: Diabetes Insipidus
Condensed Summary: Diabetes insipidus (DI) causes frequent urination. You become extremely thirsty, so you drink.

Title: Diabetes Medicines
Condensed Summary: What is diabetes? Diabetes is a disease in which your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high.

Title: Diabetes Type 1
Also Called: Insulin-dependent diabetes, Juvenile diabetes, Type I diabetes
Condensed Summary: Diabetes means your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high. With type 1 diabetes, your pancreas does not make insulin.

Title: Diabetes Type 2
Condensed Summary: What is type 2 diabetes? Type 2 diabetes is a disease in which your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high.

Title: Diabetic Diet
Condensed Summary: What is diabetes? If you have diabetes, your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high.

Title: Diabetic Eye Problems
Condensed Summary: What is diabetes? Diabetes is a disease in which your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high.

Title: Diabetic Foot
Condensed Summary: What is diabetes? Diabetes is a disease in which your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high.

Title: Diabetic Heart Disease
Condensed Summary: What is diabetes? Diabetes is a disease in which your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high.

Title: Diabetic Kidney Problems
Condensed Summary: If you have diabetes, your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high. Over time, this can damage your kidneys.

Title: Diabetic Nerve Problems
Condensed Summary: If you have diabetes, your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are too high. Over time, this can damage the covering on your nerves or the blood vessels that bring oxygen to your nerves.

Title: Diagnostic Imaging
Condensed Summary: Diagnostic imaging lets doctors look inside your body for clues about a medical condition. A variety of machines and techniques can create pictures of the structures and activities inside your body.

Title: Dialysis
Condensed Summary: When your kidneys are healthy, they clean your blood. They also make hormones that keep your bones strong and your blood healthy.

Title: Diarrhea
Condensed Summary: What is diarrhea? Diarrhea is loose, watery stools (bowel movements).

Title: Dietary Supplements
Condensed Summary: Dietary supplements are vitamins, minerals, herbs, and many other products. They can come as pills, capsules, powders, drinks, and energy bars.

Title: Digestive Diseases
Condensed Summary: When you eat, your body breaks food down to a form it can use to build and nourish cells and provide energy. This process is called digestion.

Title: Diphtheria
Condensed Summary: Diphtheria is a serious bacterial infection. You can catch it from a person who has the infection and coughs or sneezes.

Title: Dislocated Shoulder
Condensed Summary: What is a dislocated shoulder? Your shoulder joint is made up of three bones: your collarbone, your shoulder blade, and your upper arm bone.

Title: Dislocations
Condensed Summary: Dislocations are joint injuries that force the ends of your bones out of position. The cause is often a fall or a blow, sometimes from playing a contact sport.

Title: Diverticulosis and Diverticulitis
Condensed Summary: What is diverticulosis? Diverticula are small pouches, or sacs, that bulge outward through weak spots in your colon.

Title: Dizziness and Vertigo
Condensed Summary: When you're dizzy, you may feel lightheaded, woozy, or disoriented. If you feel like you or the room are spinning, you have vertigo.

Title: Down Syndrome
Condensed Summary: What is Down syndrome? Down syndrome is a condition in which a person has an extra chromosome or an extra piece of a chromosome.

Title: Drinking Water
Condensed Summary: We all need to drink water. How much you need depends on your size, activity level, and the weather where you live.

Title: Drowning
Condensed Summary: People drown when they get too much water in their lungs. You can drown in as little as an inch or two of water.

Title: Drug Reactions
Condensed Summary: Most of the time, medicines make our lives better. They reduce aches and pains, fight infections, and control problems such as high blood pressure or diabetes.

Title: Drug Safety
Condensed Summary: Before any drug can be sold in the United States, it must be approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA). This is true whether it's a prescription or an over-the-counter drug.

Title: Drug Use and Addiction
Condensed Summary: What are drugs? Drugs are chemical substances that can change how your body and mind work.

Title: Drugs and Young People
Condensed Summary: What is drug use? Drug use, or misuse, includes: Using illegal substances, such as Anabolic steroids Club drugs Cocaine Heroin Inhalants Marijuana Methamphetamines Misusing prescription medicines, including opioids.

Title: Dry Mouth
Condensed Summary: Dry mouth is the feeling that there is not enough saliva in your mouth. Everyone has a dry mouth once in a while - if they are nervous, upset or under stress.

Title: Dual Diagnosis
Condensed Summary: What is dual diagnosis? A person with dual diagnosis has both a mental disorder and an alcohol or drug problem.

Title: Dwarfism
Condensed Summary: People with dwarfism have short stature. This means that their height is under 4' 10" as an adult.

Title: Dystonia
Condensed Summary: Dystonia is a movement disorder that causes involuntary contractions of your muscles. These contractions result in twisting and repetitive movements.

Title: E-Cigarettes
Condensed Summary: E-cigarettes, or electronic cigarettes, are battery-operated smoking devices. They often look like cigarettes, but work differently.

Title: E. Coli Infections
Condensed Summary: E. coli is the name of a type of bacteria that lives in your intestines. Most types of E. coli are harmless.

Title: Ear Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your ear has three main parts: outer, middle and inner. You use all of them in hearing.

Title: Ear Infections
Condensed Summary: Ear infections are the most common reason parents bring their child to a doctor. Three out of four children will have at least one ear infection by their third birthday.

Title: Eating Disorders
Condensed Summary: What are eating disorders? Eating disorders are serious mental health disorders.

Title: Ebola
Also Called: Ebola hemorrhagic fever, Ebola virus disease
Condensed Summary: What is Ebola? Ebola, also known as Ebola virus disease (EVD), is a type of hemorrhagic fever.

Title: Ectopic Pregnancy
Condensed Summary: The uterus, or womb, is the place where a baby grows when a woman is pregnant. If you have an ectopic pregnancy, the fertilized egg grows in the wrong place, outside the uterus, usually in the fallopian tubes.

Title: Eczema
Condensed Summary: Eczema is a term for several different types of skin swelling. Eczema is also called dermatitis.

Title: Edema
Condensed Summary: Edema means swelling caused by fluid in your body's tissues. It usually occurs in the feet, ankles and legs, but it can involve your entire body.

Title: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome (EDS) is a group of inherited disorders that weaken connective tissues. Connective tissues are proteins that support skin, bones, blood vessels, and other organs.

Title: Elbow Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your elbow joint is made up of bone, cartilage, ligaments and fluid. Muscles and tendons help the elbow joint move.

Title: Elder Abuse
Condensed Summary: Many older people are victims of elder abuse. It is the mistreatment of an older person, usually by a caregiver.

Title: Electrical Injuries
Condensed Summary: When you come in direct contact with electricity, it can pass through your body and cause injuries. These electrical injuries can be external or internal.

Title: Electromagnetic Fields
Condensed Summary: Electric and magnetic fields (EMFs), also called radiation, are areas of energy that surround electrical devices. Everyday sources of EMFs include: Power lines Electrical wiring Microwave ovens Computers Cell phones Some people worry about EMF exposure and cancer.

Title: Emphysema
Condensed Summary: What is emphysema? Emphysema is a type of COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease).

Title: Encephalitis
Condensed Summary: Encephalitis is an inflammation of the brain. Usually the cause is a viral infection, but bacteria can also cause it.

Title: Endocarditis
Condensed Summary: What is endocarditis? Endocarditis is sometimes called infective endocarditis.

Title: Endocrine Diseases
Condensed Summary: Your endocrine system includes eight major glands throughout your body. These glands make hormones.

Title: Endometriosis
Condensed Summary: What is endometriosis? The uterus, or womb, is the place where a baby grows when a person is pregnant.

Title: Endoscopy
Condensed Summary: Endoscopy is a procedure that lets your doctor look inside your body. It uses an instrument called an endoscope, or scope for short.

Title: Enlarged Prostate (BPH)
Condensed Summary: What is the prostate? The prostate is a gland in the male reproductive system.

Title: Environmental Health
Condensed Summary: Our environment affects our health. If parts of the environment, like the air, water, or soil become polluted, it can lead to health problems.

Title: Eosinophilic Disorders
Condensed Summary: Eosinophils are a type of white blood cell. They help fight off infections and play a role in your body's immune response.

Title: Eosinophilic Esophagitis
Condensed Summary: What is eosinophilic esophagitis (EoE)? Eosinophilic esophagitis (EoE) is a chronic disease of the esophagus.

Title: Epilepsy
Condensed Summary: Epilepsy is a brain disorder that causes people to have recurring seizures. The seizures happen when clusters of nerve cells, or neurons, in the brain send out the wrong signals.

Title: Erectile Dysfunction
Condensed Summary: Erectile dysfunction (ED) is a common type of male sexual dysfunction. It is when a man has trouble getting or keeping an erection.

Title: Ergonomics
Condensed Summary: Ergonomics looks at what kind of work you do, what tools you use and your whole job environment. The aim is to find the best fit between you and your job conditions.

Title: Esophageal Cancer
Condensed Summary: The esophagus is a hollow tube that carries food and liquids from your throat to your stomach. Early esophageal cancer usually does not cause symptoms.

Title: Esophagus Disorders
Condensed Summary: The esophagus is the muscular tube that carries food and liquids from your mouth to the stomach. You may not be aware of your esophagus until you swallow something too large, too hot, or too cold.

Title: Exercise for Children
Condensed Summary: Like adults, kids need exercise. Most children need at least an hour of physical activity every day.

Title: Exercise for Older Adults
Condensed Summary: Exercise and physical activity are good for just about everyone, including older adults. There are four main types and each type is different.

Title: Eye Cancer
Condensed Summary: Cancer of the eye is uncommon. It can affect the outer parts of the eye, such as the eyelid, which are made up of muscles, skin and nerves.

Title: Eye Care
Condensed Summary: Your eyes are an important part of your health. Most people rely on their eyes to see and make sense of the world around them.

Title: Eye Diseases
Condensed Summary: Some eye problems are minor and don't last long. But some can lead to a permanent loss of vision.

Title: Eye Infections
Condensed Summary: Your eyes can get infections from bacteria, fungi, or viruses. Eye infections can occur in different parts of the eye and can affect just one eye or both.

Title: Eye Injuries
Condensed Summary: The structure of your face helps protect your eyes from injury. Still, injuries can damage your eye, sometimes severely enough that you could lose your vision.

Title: Eye Movement Disorders
Condensed Summary: When you look at an object, you're using several muscles to move both eyes to focus on it. If you have a problem with the muscles, the eyes don't work properly.

Title: Eye Wear
Condensed Summary: Eye wear protects or corrects your vision. Examples are: Sunglasses Safety goggles Glasses (also called eyeglasses)

Title: Eyelid Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your eyelids help protect your eyes. When you blink, your eyelids spread moisture over your eyes.

Title: Facial Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Face injuries and disorders can cause pain and affect how you look. In severe cases, they can affect sight, speech, breathing and your ability to swallow.

Title: Fainting
Condensed Summary: Fainting is a temporary loss of consciousness. If you're about to faint, you'll feel dizzy, lightheaded, or nauseous.

Title: Falls
Condensed Summary: Falls can be dangerous at any age. Babies and young children can get hurt falling off furniture or down the stairs.

Title: Family History
Condensed Summary: Your family history includes health information about you and your close relatives. Families have many factors in common, including their genes, environment, and lifestyle.

Title: Fatigue
Condensed Summary: Everyone feels tired now and then. Sometimes you may just want to stay in bed.

Title: Fatty Liver Disease
Also Called: Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease, Alcoholic Steatohepatitis, NAFLD, NASH, Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease, Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis
Condensed Summary: What is fatty liver disease? Your liver is the largest organ inside your body.

Title: Female Infertility
Condensed Summary: Infertility means not being able to get pregnant after at least one year of trying (or 6 months if the woman is over age 35). If a woman keeps having miscarriages, it is also called infertility.

Title: Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders
Condensed Summary: Alcohol can harm your baby at any stage during a pregnancy. That includes the earliest stages, before you even know you are pregnant.

Title: Fetal Health and Development
Condensed Summary: A normal pregnancy lasts nine months. Each three-month period of pregnancy is called a trimester.

Title: Fever
Condensed Summary: A fever is a body temperature that is higher than normal. A normal temperature can vary from person to person, but it is usually around 98.6 F (37 C).

Title: Fibromyalgia
Condensed Summary: What is fibromyalgia? Fibromyalgia is chronic condition that causes pain all over the body, fatigue, and other symptoms.

Title: Fifth Disease
Condensed Summary: Fifth disease is a viral infection caused by parvovirus B19. The virus only infects humans; it's not the same parvovirus that dogs and cats can get.

Title: Finger Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: You use your fingers and thumbs to do everything from grasping objects to playing musical instruments to typing. When there is something wrong with them, it can make life difficult.

Title: First Aid
Condensed Summary: Accidents happen. Someone chokes on an ice cube or gets stung by a bee.

Title: Fistulas
Condensed Summary: A fistula is an abnormal connection between two parts inside of the body. Fistulas may develop between different organs, such as between the esophagus and the windpipe or the bowel and the vagina.

Title: Flu
Condensed Summary: What is the flu? The flu, also called influenza, is a respiratory infection caused by viruses.

Title: Flu Shot
Condensed Summary: Flu is a respiratory infection caused by a number of viruses. Most people with the flu get better on their own.

Title: Food Allergy
Condensed Summary: Food allergy is an abnormal response to a food triggered by your body's immune system. In adults, the foods that most often trigger allergic reactions include fish, shellfish, peanuts, and tree nuts, such as walnuts.

Title: Food Safety
Condensed Summary: Safe steps in food handling, cooking, and storage can prevent foodborne illness. There are four basic steps to food safety at home: Clean - always wash your fruits and vegetables, hands, counters, and cooking utensils.

Title: Foodborne Illness
Condensed Summary: Each year, around 48 million people in the United States get sick from contaminated food. Common causes include bacteria and viruses.

Title: Foot Health
Condensed Summary: Each step you take involves a complex network of bones, muscles, tendons, and ligaments. This, combined with all of the weight they carry, explains why feet can have problems.

Title: Foot Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Each of your feet has 26 bones, 33 joints, and more than 100 tendons, muscles, and ligaments. No wonder a lot of things can go wrong.

Title: Foreign Bodies
Condensed Summary: If you've ever gotten a splinter or had sand in your eye, you've had experience with a foreign body. A foreign body is something that is stuck inside you but isn't supposed to be there.

Title: Fractures
Condensed Summary: A fracture is a break, usually in a bone. If the broken bone punctures the skin, it is called an open or compound fracture.

Title: Fragile X Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Fragile X syndrome is the most common form of inherited developmental disability. A problem with a specific gene causes the disease.

Title: Friedreich Ataxia
Condensed Summary: Friedreich ataxia is an inherited disease that damages your nervous system. The damage affects your spinal cord and the nerves that control muscle movement in your arms and legs.

Title: Frostbite
Condensed Summary: Frostbite is an injury to the body that is caused by freezing. It most often affects the nose, ears, cheeks, chin, fingers, or toes.

Title: Fungal Infections
Condensed Summary: If you have ever had athlete's foot or a yeast infection, you can blame a fungus. A fungus is a primitive organism.

Title: G6PD Deficiency
Condensed Summary: Glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency is a genetic disorder that is most common in males. About 1 in 10 African American males in the United States has it.

Title: Gallbladder Cancer
Condensed Summary: Your gallbladder is a pear-shaped organ under your liver. It stores bile, a fluid made by your liver to digest fat.

Title: Gallbladder Diseases
Condensed Summary: Your gallbladder is a pear-shaped organ under your liver. It stores bile, a fluid made by your liver to digest fat.

Title: Gallstones
Condensed Summary: Your gallbladder is a pear-shaped organ under your liver. It stores bile, a fluid made by your liver to digest fat.

Title: Gangrene
Condensed Summary: Gangrene is the death of tissues in your body. It happens when a part of your body loses its blood supply.

Title: Gas
Condensed Summary: Everyone has gas. Most people pass gas 13 to 21 times a day.

Title: Gastroenteritis
Condensed Summary: What is gastroenteritis? Gastroenteritis is an inflammation of the lining of the stomach and intestines.

Title: Gastrointestinal Bleeding
Condensed Summary: Your digestive or gastrointestinal (GI) tract includes the esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine or colon, rectum, and anus. Bleeding can come from any of these areas.

Title: Gaucher Disease
Condensed Summary: Gaucher disease is a rare, inherited disorder. It is a type of lipid metabolism disorder.

Title: Genes and Gene Therapy
Condensed Summary: Genes are the building blocks of inheritance. Passed from parent to child, they contain instructions for making proteins.

Title: Genetic Brain Disorders
Condensed Summary: A genetic brain disorder is caused by a variation or a mutation in a gene. A variation is a different form of a gene.

Title: Genetic Counseling
Condensed Summary: Genetic counseling provides information and support to people who have, or may be at risk for, genetic disorders. A genetic counselor meets with you to discuss genetic risks.

Title: Genetic Disorders
Condensed Summary: Genes are the building blocks of heredity. They are passed from parent to child.

Title: Genetic Testing
Condensed Summary: What is genetic testing? Genetic testing is a type of medical test that looks for changes in your DNA.

Title: Genital Herpes
Condensed Summary: Genital herpes is a sexually transmitted disease (STD) caused by a herpes simplex virus (HSV). It can cause sores on your genital or rectal area, buttocks, and thighs.

Title: Genital Warts
Condensed Summary: Genital warts are a sexually transmitted disease (STD) caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV). The warts usually appear as a small bump or group of bumps in the genital area.

Title: GERD
Condensed Summary: Your esophagus is the tube that carries food from your mouth to your stomach. Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) happens when a muscle at the end of your esophagus does not close properly.

Title: Germs and Hygiene
Condensed Summary: What are germs? Germs are microorganisms.

Title: Giant Cell Arteritis
Condensed Summary: Giant cell arteritis is a disorder that causes inflammation of your arteries, usually in the scalp, neck, and arms. It narrows the arteries, which keeps blood from flowing well.

Title: Giardia Infections
Condensed Summary: Giardiasis is an illness caused by a parasite called Giardia intestinalis. It lives in soil, food, and water.

Title: Glaucoma
Condensed Summary: Glaucoma is a group of diseases that can damage the eye's optic nerve. It is a leading cause of blindness in the United States.

Title: Gluten Sensitivity
Condensed Summary: Gluten is a protein found in wheat, rye, and barley. It is found mainly in foods but may also be in other products like medicines, vitamins, and supplements.

Title: Gonorrhea
Condensed Summary: Gonorrhea is a sexually transmitted disease. It is most common in young adults.

Title: Gout
Condensed Summary: Gout is a common, painful form of arthritis. It causes swollen, red, hot and stiff joints.

Title: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis
Condensed Summary: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA), previously known as Wegener's granulomatosis, is a rare disease. It is a type of vasculitis, or inflammation of the blood vessels.

Title: Growth Disorders
Condensed Summary: Does your child seem much shorter - or much taller - than other kids his or her age? It could be normal.

Title: Guide to Good Posture
Condensed Summary: Good posture is about more than standing up straight so you can look your best.

Title: Guillain-Barre Syndrome
Also Called: Acute idiopathic polyneuritis, Acute inflammatory polyneuropathy, Infectious polyneuritis, Landry-Guillain-Barre syndrome
Condensed Summary: Guillain-Barre syndrome is a rare disorder that causes your immune system to attack your peripheral nervous system (PNS). The PNS nerves connect your brain and spinal cord with the rest of your body.

Title: Gum Disease
Condensed Summary: If you have gum disease, you're not alone. Many U.S. adults currently have some form of the disease.

Title: H1N1 Flu (Swine Flu)
Condensed Summary: Swine flu is an infection caused by a virus. It's named for a virus that pigs can get.

Title: Haemophilus Infections
Condensed Summary: Haemophilus is the name of a group of bacteria. There are several types of Haemophilus.

Title: Hair Loss
Condensed Summary: You lose up to 100 hairs from your scalp every day. That's normal, and in most people, those hairs grow back.

Title: Hair Problems
Condensed Summary: The average person has 5 million hairs. Hair grows all over your body except on your lips, palms, and the soles of your feet.

Title: Hand Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: No matter how old you are or what you do for a living, you are always using your hands. When there is something wrong with them, you may not be able to do your regular activities.

Title: Hantavirus Infections
Condensed Summary: Hantavirus pulmonary syndrome (HPS) is a rare but deadly viral infection. It is spread by mice and rats.

Title: Hay Fever
Condensed Summary: Each spring, summer, and fall, trees, weeds, and grasses release tiny pollen grains into the air. Some of the pollen ends up in your nose and throat.

Title: HDL: The "Good" Cholesterol
Condensed Summary: What is cholesterol? Cholesterol is a waxy, fat-like substance that's found in all the cells in your body.

Title: Head and Neck Cancer
Condensed Summary: What is head and neck cancer? Head and neck cancer is the name for cancers that develop in the mouth, nose and sinuses, salivary glands, and throat and voice box (larynx).

Title: Head Injuries
Also Called: Cranial injuries, Skull fractures, Skull injuries
Condensed Summary: Chances are you've bumped your head before. Often, the injury is minor because your skull is hard and it protects your brain.

Title: Head Lice
Condensed Summary: What are head lice? Head lice are tiny insects that live on people's heads.

Title: Headache
Condensed Summary: Almost everyone has had a headache. Headache is the most common form of pain.

Title: Health Disparities
Condensed Summary: Health disparities are health differences between different groups of people. These health differences may include: How many people get certain diseases How severe the diseases are How many people have complications because of the diseases How many people die from a disease Whether people can get health care How many people get screened for a disease These groups of people may be based on: Race Ethnicity Immigrant status Disability Sex or gender Sexual orientation Geography Income Level of education NIH: National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities

Title: Health Problems in Pregnancy
Condensed Summary: Every pregnancy has some risk of problems, but there are certain conditions and health issues that can raise that risk, such as: A health condition you had before you got pregnant A health condition you develop during pregnancy A pregnancy with more than one baby A health problem that happened during a previous pregnancy and could happen again Substance use during pregnancy Being over age 35 Any of these can affect your health, the health of your baby, or both. If you have a chronic condition, you should talk to your health care provider about how to minimize your risk before you get pregnant.

Title: Healthy Aging
Condensed Summary: People in the U.S. are living longer, and the number of older adults in the population is growing. As we age, our minds and bodies change.

Title: Healthy Sleep
Condensed Summary: What is sleep? While you are sleeping, you are unconscious, but your brain and body functions are still active.

Title: Hearing Aids
Condensed Summary: A hearing aid is a small electronic device that you wear in or behind your ear. It makes some sounds louder.

Title: Hearing Disorders and Deafness
Condensed Summary: It's frustrating to be unable to hear well enough to enjoy talking with friends or family. Hearing disorders make it hard, but not impossible, to hear.

Title: Hearing Problems in Children
Condensed Summary: Most children hear and listen from the moment they are born. They learn to talk by imitating the sounds around them and the voices of their parents and caregivers.

Title: Heart Attack
Condensed Summary: Each year almost 800,000 Americans have a heart attack. A heart attack happens when blood flow to the heart suddenly becomes blocked.

Title: Heart Disease in Women
Condensed Summary: What is heart disease? Heart disease is a general term that includes many types of heart problems.

Title: Heart Diseases
Condensed Summary: What is heart disease? Heart disease is a general term that includes many types of heart problems.

Title: Heart Failure
Also Called: CHF, Cardiac failure, Congestive heart failure, Left-sided heart failure, Right-sided heart failure
Condensed Summary: What is heart failure? Heart failure means that your heart can't pump enough oxygen-rich blood to meet your body's needs.

Title: Heart Health Tests
Condensed Summary: Heart diseases are the number one killer in the U.S. They are also a major cause of disability.

Title: Heart Surgery
Condensed Summary: What is heart surgery? Heart surgery can correct certain heart problems when other treatments haven't worked or can't be used.

Title: Heart Transplantation
