Condensed Summary: A heart transplant removes a damaged or diseased heart and replaces it with a healthy one. The healthy heart comes from a donor who has died.

Title: Heart Valve Diseases
Condensed Summary: What are heart valve diseases? Heart valve disease happens when one or more of your heart valves don't work well.

Title: Heartburn
Condensed Summary: Heartburn is a painful burning feeling in your chest or throat. It happens when stomach acid backs up into your esophagus, the tube that carries food from your mouth to your stomach.

Title: Heat Illness
Condensed Summary: Your body normally cools itself by sweating. During hot weather, especially when it is very humid, sweating just isn't enough to cool you off.

Title: Heel Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Heel problems are common and can be painful. Often, they result from too much stress on your heel bone and the tissues that surround it.

Title: Helicobacter Pylori Infections
Condensed Summary: Helicobacter pylori (H. pylori) is a type of bacteria that causes infection in the stomach. It is the main cause of peptic ulcers, and it can also cause gastritis and stomach cancer.

Title: Hemochromatosis
Condensed Summary: Hemochromatosis is a disease in which too much iron builds up in your body. Your body needs iron but too much of it is toxic.

Title: Hemophilia
Also Called: Christmas disease, Factor IX deficiency, Factor VIII deficiency
Condensed Summary: What is hemophilia? Hemophilia is a rare bleeding disorder in which the blood does not clot properly.

Title: Hemorrhagic Fevers
Condensed Summary: Viral hemorrhagic fevers (VHFs) are a group of illnesses caused by four families of viruses. These include the Ebola and Marburg, Lassa fever, and yellow fever viruses.

Title: Hemorrhagic Stroke
Condensed Summary: A stroke is a medical emergency. There are two types - ischemic and hemorrhagic.

Title: Hemorrhoids
Condensed Summary: What are hemorrhoids? Hemorrhoids are swollen, inflamed veins around your anus or the lower part of your rectum.

Title: Hepatitis
Condensed Summary: What is hepatitis? Hepatitis is inflammation of the liver.

Title: Hepatitis A
Condensed Summary: What is Hepatitis? Hepatitis is inflammation of the liver.

Title: Hepatitis B
Condensed Summary: What is hepatitis? Hepatitis is inflammation of the liver.

Title: Hepatitis C
Condensed Summary: What is hepatitis C? Hepatitis is inflammation of the liver.

Title: Herbal Medicine
Condensed Summary: An herb is a plant or plant part used for its scent, flavor, or therapeutic properties. Herbal medicines are one type of dietary supplement.

Title: Hernia
Condensed Summary: A hernia happens when part of an internal organ or tissue bulges through a weak area of muscle. Most hernias are in the abdomen.

Title: Herniated Disk
Also Called: Bulging disk, Compressed disk, Herniated intervertebral disk, Herniated nucleus pulposus, Prolapsed disk, Ruptured disk, Slipped disk
Condensed Summary: Your backbone, or spine, is made up of 26 bones called vertebrae. In between them are soft disks filled with a jelly-like substance.

Title: Heroin
Also Called: Big H, Black tar, H, Horse, Junk, Smack, TNT, Thunder
Condensed Summary: What is heroin? Heroin is an illegal, very addictive opioid drug.

Title: Herpes Simplex
Condensed Summary: Herpes is an infection that is caused by a herpes simplex virus (HSV). Oral herpes causes cold sores around the mouth or face.

Title: Hiatal Hernia
Condensed Summary: A hiatal hernia is a condition in which the upper part of your stomach bulges through an opening in your diaphragm. Your diaphragm is the thin muscle that separates your chest from your abdomen.

Title: Hiccups
Condensed Summary: What are hiccups? Have you ever wondered what is happening when you hiccup?

Title: Hidradenitis Suppurativa
Condensed Summary: What is hidradenitis suppurativa (HS)? Hidradenitis suppurativa (HS) is a chronic skin disease.

Title: High Blood Pressure
Also Called: Benign essential hypertension, Essential hypertension, HBP, HTN, Hypertension
Condensed Summary: What is blood pressure? Blood pressure is the force of your blood pushing against the walls of your arteries.

Title: High Blood Pressure in Pregnancy
Condensed Summary: What is high blood pressure in pregnancy? Blood pressure is the force of your blood pushing against the walls of your arteries as your heart pumps blood.

Title: High Cholesterol in Children and Teens
Condensed Summary: What is cholesterol? Cholesterol is a waxy, fat-like substance that's found in all the cells in the body.

Title: Hip Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your hip is the joint where your femur (thigh bone) meets your pelvis (hip bone). There are two main parts: a ball at the end of the femur, which fits in a socket in the pelvis.

Title: Hip Replacement
Condensed Summary: Hip replacement is surgery for people with severe hip damage. The most common cause of damage is osteoarthritis.

Title: Histoplasmosis
Condensed Summary: Histoplasmosis is a disease caused by a fungus (or mold) called Histoplasma. The fungus is common in the eastern and central United States.

Title: HIV
Also Called: AIDS, Acquired immunodeficiency syndrome, Human immunodeficiency virus
Condensed Summary: What is HIV? HIV stands for human immunodeficiency virus.

Title: HIV and Infections
Condensed Summary: Having HIV/AIDS weakens your body's immune system. It destroys the white blood cells that fight infection.

Title: HIV and Pregnancy
Condensed Summary: If you are pregnant or planning to get pregnant, it's important to get tested for HIV as soon as possible. If you find out that do have HIV, you can start treatment right away to protect your health and the health of your baby.

Title: HIV in Women
Condensed Summary: What is HIV? HIV stands for human immunodeficiency virus.

Title: HIV Medicines
Condensed Summary: What is HIV? HIV stands for human immunodeficiency virus.

Title: HIV: PrEP and PEP
Condensed Summary: What are PrEP and PEP? PrEP and PEP are medicines to prevent HIV.

Title: Hives
Condensed Summary: Hives are red and sometimes itchy bumps on your skin. An allergic reaction to a drug or food usually causes them.

Title: Hodgkin Lymphoma
Condensed Summary: What is Hodgkin lymphoma? Hodgkin lymphoma, also called Hodgkin disease, is a type of cancer that develops in the lymph system.

Title: Home Care Services
Condensed Summary: Home care is care that allows a person with special needs to stay in their home. It might be for people who are getting older (aging in place).

Title: Hormone Replacement Therapy
Also Called: ERT, Estrogen replacement therapy, HRT, Menopausal hormone therapy
Condensed Summary: Menopause is the time in a woman's life when her period stops. It is a normal part of aging.

Title: Hormones
Condensed Summary: Hormones are your body's chemical messengers. They travel in your bloodstream to tissues or organs.

Title: Household Products
Condensed Summary: The products you use for cleaning, carpentry, auto repair, gardening, and many other household uses can contain ingredients that can harm you, your family, and the environment. These include : Oven and drain cleaners Cleaning and disinfecting products, including bleach and antibacterial cleaners Laundry powder Floor polish Paint thinners, strippers, and removers Pesticides Grease and rust removers Motor oil and fuel additives Arts and craft supplies Toxic substances in these products can cause harm if inhaled, swallowed, or absorbed through the skin.

Title: How to Improve Mental Health
Also Called: Boost Emotional Wellness, Improve Emotional Health, Stay Positive
Condensed Summary: What is mental health? Mental health includes our emotional, psychological, and social well-being.

Title: How to Lower Cholesterol
Condensed Summary: What is cholesterol? Your body needs some cholesterol to work properly.

Title: How to Lower Cholesterol with Diet
Also Called: Low Cholesterol Diet, TLC Diet, Therapeutic Lifestyle Changes Diet
Condensed Summary: What is cholesterol? Your body needs some cholesterol to work properly.

Title: How to Prevent Diabetes
Condensed Summary: What is type 2 diabetes? If you have diabetes, your blood sugar levels are too high.

Title: How to Prevent Heart Disease
Condensed Summary: Heart disease is the leading cause of the death in the United States. It is also a major cause of disability.

Title: How to Prevent High Blood Pressure
Condensed Summary: More than 1 in 3 adults in the U.S. has high blood pressure, or hypertension. Many of those people don't know they have it, because there are usually no warning signs.

Title: HPV
Condensed Summary: What is HPV? Human papillomavirus (HPV) is a group of related viruses.

Title: Huntington's Disease
Condensed Summary: Huntington's disease (HD) is an inherited disease that causes certain nerve cells in the brain to waste away. People are born with the defective gene, but symptoms usually don't appear until middle age.

Title: Hydrocephalus
Condensed Summary: Hydrocephalus is the buildup of too much cerebrospinal fluid in the brain. Normally, this fluid cushions your brain.

Title: Hyperglycemia
Also Called: High blood glucose, High blood sugar
Condensed Summary: What is blood glucose? Blood glucose, or blood sugar, is the main sugar found in your blood.

Title: Hyperthyroidism
Condensed Summary: What is hyperthyroidism? Hyperthyroidism, or overactive thyroid, happens when your thyroid gland makes more thyroid hormones than your body needs.

Title: Hypoglycemia
Condensed Summary: What is blood glucose? Blood glucose, or blood sugar, is the main sugar found in your blood.

Title: Hypothermia
Condensed Summary: Cold weather can affect your body in different ways. You can get frostbite, which is an injury to the body that is caused by freezing.

Title: Hypothyroidism
Condensed Summary: What is hypothyroidism? Hypothyroidism, or underactive thyroid, happens when your thyroid gland doesn't make enough thyroid hormones to meet your body's needs.

Title: Hysterectomy
Condensed Summary: A hysterectomy is surgery to remove a woman's uterus or womb. The uterus is the place where a baby grows when a woman is pregnant.

Title: Immune System and Disorders
Condensed Summary: What is the immune system? Your immune system is a complex network of cells, tissues, and organs.

Title: Impetigo
Condensed Summary: Impetigo is a skin infection caused by bacteria. It is usually caused by staphylococcal (staph) bacteria, but it can also be caused by streptococcal (strep) bacteria.

Title: Indigestion
Condensed Summary: Nearly everyone has had indigestion at one time. It's a feeling of discomfort or a burning feeling in your upper abdomen.

Title: Indoor Air Pollution
Condensed Summary: We usually think of air pollution as being outdoors, but the air in your house or office could also be polluted. Sources of indoor pollution include: Mold and pollen Tobacco smoke Household products and pesticides Gases such as radon and carbon monoxide Materials used in the building such as asbestos, formaldehyde and lead Sometimes a group of people have symptoms that seem to be linked to time spent in a certain building.

Title: Infant and Newborn Care
Condensed Summary: Going home with a new baby is exciting, but it can be scary, too. Newborns have many needs, like frequent feedings and diaper changes.

Title: Infant and Newborn Development
Condensed Summary: When will my baby take his first step or say her first word? During their first year, babies start to develop skills they will use for the rest of their lives.

Title: Infant and Newborn Nutrition
Condensed Summary: Food provides the energy and nutrients that babies need to be healthy. For a baby, breast milk is best.

Title: Infection Control
Condensed Summary: Every year, lives are lost because of the spread of infections in hospitals. Health care workers can take steps to prevent the spread of infectious diseases.

Title: Infections and Pregnancy
Condensed Summary: During pregnancy, some common infections like the common cold or a skin infection do not usually cause serious problems. But other infections can be dangerous to you, your baby, or both.

Title: Infectious Arthritis
Condensed Summary: Most kinds of arthritis cause pain and swelling in your joints. Joints are places where two bones meet, such as your elbow or knee.

Title: Infectious Diseases
Condensed Summary: What are infectious diseases? Germs, or microbes, are found everywhere - in the air, soil, and water.

Title: Infectious Mononucleosis
Also Called: Glandular fever, Kissing disease, Mono, Mononucleosis
Condensed Summary: Infectious mononucleosis, or "mono", is an infection usually caused by the Epstein-Barr virus. The virus spreads through saliva, which is why it's sometimes called "kissing disease."

Title: Infertility
Condensed Summary: Infertility means not being able to become pregnant after a year of trying. If a woman can get pregnant but keeps having miscarriages or stillbirths, that's also called infertility.

Title: Inhalants
Condensed Summary: What are inhalants? Inhalants are substances that people inhale (breathe in) to get high.

Title: Inhalation Injuries
Condensed Summary: Inhalation injuries are acute injuries to your respiratory system and lungs. They can happen if you breathe in toxic substances, such as smoke (from fires), chemicals, particle pollution, and gases.

Title: Insect Bites and Stings
Condensed Summary: Most insect bites are harmless, though they sometimes cause discomfort. Bee, wasp, and hornet stings and fire ant bites usually hurt.

Title: Insomnia
Condensed Summary: What is insomnia? Insomnia is a common sleep disorder.

Title: Interstitial Cystitis
Also Called: Bladder pain syndrome, IC, PBS, Painful bladder syndrome
Condensed Summary: Interstitial cystitis (IC) is a condition that causes discomfort or pain in the bladder and a need to urinate frequently and urgently. It is far more common in women than in men.

Title: Interstitial Lung Diseases
Condensed Summary: Interstitial lung disease is the name for a large group of diseases that inflame or scar the lungs. The inflammation and scarring make it hard to get enough oxygen.

Title: Intestinal Cancer
Also Called: Duodenal cancer, Ileal cancer, Jejunal cancer, Small intestine cancer
Condensed Summary: Your small intestine is part of your digestive system. It is a long tube that connects your stomach to your large intestine.

Title: Intestinal Obstruction
Also Called: Bowel obstruction, Intestinal volvulus, Paralytic ileus
Condensed Summary: An intestinal obstruction occurs when food or stool cannot move through the intestines. The obstruction can be complete or partial.

Title: Intimate Partner Violence
Also Called: Battery, Domestic violence, Partner abuse, Spousal abuse
Condensed Summary: What is intimate partner violence (IPV)? Intimate partner violence (IPV) is abuse that happens in a romantic relationship.

Title: Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a problem that affects the large intestine. It can cause abdominal cramping, bloating, and a change in bowel habits.

Title: Ischemic Stroke
Condensed Summary: A stroke is a medical emergency. There are two types - ischemic and hemorrhagic.

Title: Islet Cell Transplantation
Condensed Summary: Islets are cells found in clusters throughout the pancreas. They are made up of several types of cells.

Title: Itching
Condensed Summary: What is itching? Itching is an irritating sensation that makes you want to scratch your skin.

Title: Jaundice
Condensed Summary: Jaundice causes your skin and the whites of your eyes to turn yellow. Too much bilirubin causes jaundice.

Title: Jaw Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your jaw is a set of bones that holds your teeth. It consists of two main parts.

Title: Joint Disorders
Condensed Summary: What are joints? Your joints are places where two or more bones come together.

Title: Juvenile Arthritis
Also Called: Childhood arthritis, JRA, Juvenile idiopathic arthritis, Still's disease
Condensed Summary: Juvenile arthritis (JA) is arthritis that happens in children. It causes joint swelling, pain, stiffness, and loss of motion.

Title: Kaposi Sarcoma
Condensed Summary: What is Kaposi sarcoma? Kaposi sarcoma, sometimes called KS, is a type of cancer.

Title: Kawasaki Disease
Condensed Summary: What is Kawasaki disease? Kawasaki disease is a rare illness that usually affects small children.

Title: Kidney Cancer
Condensed Summary: You have two kidneys. They are fist-sized organs on either side of your backbone above your waist.

Title: Kidney Cysts
Condensed Summary: A cyst is a fluid-filled sac. You may get simple kidney cysts as you age; they are usually harmless.

Title: Kidney Diseases
Condensed Summary: You have two kidneys, each about the size of your fist. They are near the middle of your back, just below the rib cage.

Title: Kidney Failure
Also Called: ESRD, End-stage renal disease, Renal failure
Condensed Summary: Healthy kidneys clean your blood by removing excess fluid, minerals, and wastes. They also make hormones that keep your bones strong and your blood healthy.

Title: Kidney Stones
Condensed Summary: A kidney stone is a solid piece of material that forms in the kidney from substances in the urine. It may be as small as a grain of sand or as large as a pearl.

Title: Kidney Tests
Also Called: Kidney Function Panel, Kidney Function Tests, Kidney Panel, Renal Function Panel
Condensed Summary: You have two kidneys. They are fist-sized organs on either side of your backbone above your waist.

Title: Kidney Transplantation
Condensed Summary: A kidney transplant is an operation that places a healthy kidney in your body. The transplanted kidney takes over the work of the two kidneys that failed, so you no longer need dialysis.

Title: Klinefelter Syndrome
Condensed Summary: What is Klinefelter syndrome (KS)? Klinefelter syndrome (KS) is a genetic condition that happens when a male is born with an extra copy of the X chromosome.

Title: Knee Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your knee joint is made up of bone, cartilage, ligaments and fluid. Muscles and tendons help the knee joint move.

Title: Knee Replacement
Condensed Summary: What is knee replacement surgery? Knee replacement surgery is a surgery to replace parts of your knee joint with new, artificial parts.

Title: Laboratory Tests
Condensed Summary: Laboratory tests check a sample of your blood, urine, or body tissues. A technician or your doctor analyzes the test samples to see if your results fall within the normal range.

Title: Lactose Intolerance
Also Called: Dairy product intolerance, Lactase deficiency, Milk intolerance
Condensed Summary: Lactose intolerance means that you cannot digest foods with lactose in them. Lactose is the sugar found in milk and foods made with milk.

Title: Laser Eye Surgery
Condensed Summary: For many people, laser eye surgery can correct their vision so they no longer need glasses or contact lenses. Laser eye surgery reshapes the cornea, the clear front part of the eye.

Title: Latex Allergy
Condensed Summary: Latex is a milky fluid that comes from the tropical rubber tree. Hundreds of everyday products contain latex.

Title: Latino and Hispanic American Health
Condensed Summary: Every racial or ethnic group has specific health concerns. Differences in the health of groups can result from: Genetics Environmental factors Access to care Cultural factors On this page, you'll find links to health issues that affect Latino and Hispanic Americans.

Title: LDL: The "Bad" Cholesterol
Condensed Summary: What is cholesterol? Cholesterol is a waxy, fat-like substance that's found in all the cells in your body.

Title: Lead Poisoning
Condensed Summary: Lead is a metal that occurs naturally in the earth's crust. Lead can be found in all parts of our environment.

Title: Learning Disabilities
Condensed Summary: What is a learning disability? Learning disabilities are conditions that affect the ability to learn.

Title: Leg Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your legs are made up of bones, blood vessels, muscles, and other connective tissue. They are important for motion and standing.

Title: Legionnaires' Disease
Condensed Summary: Legionnaires' disease is a type of pneumonia caused by bacteria. You usually get it by breathing in mist from water that contains the bacteria.

Title: Leishmaniasis
Condensed Summary: Leishmaniasis is a parasitic disease spread by the bite of infected sand flies. There are several different forms of leishmaniasis.

Title: Leukemia
Condensed Summary: What is leukemia? Leukemia is a term for cancers of the blood cells.

Title: Leukodystrophies
Condensed Summary: What are leukodystrophies? Leukodystrophies are a group of rare genetic disorders that affect the central nervous system (CNS).

Title: Lewy Body Dementia
Also Called: Dementia with Lewy bodies, LBD, Lewy Body Disease, Parkinson's disease dementia
Condensed Summary: What is Lewy body dementia (LBD)? Lewy body dementia (LBD) is one of the most common types of dementia in older adults.

Title: LGBTQIA+ Health
Condensed Summary: Members of the LGBTQIA+ community include people who are: Lesbian Gay Bisexual Transgender Queer or Questioning Intersex Asexual Elsewhere on the gender and sexuality spectrum or allies to the community On this page you'll find information about health issues that are specific to the LGBTQIA+ community.

Title: Limb Loss
Condensed Summary: People can lose all or part of an arm or leg for a number of reasons. Common ones include: Problems with blood circulation.

Title: Lipid Metabolism Disorders
Condensed Summary: Metabolism is the process your body uses to make energy from the food you eat. Food is made up of proteins, carbohydrates, and fats.

Title: Listeria Infections
Condensed Summary: Listeriosis is a foodborne illness caused by Listeria monocytogenes, bacteria found in soil and water. It can be in a variety of raw foods as well as in processed foods and foods made from unpasteurized milk.

Title: Liver Cancer
Condensed Summary: Your liver is the largest organ inside your body. It helps your body digest food, store energy, and remove poisons.

Title: Liver Diseases
Condensed Summary: Your liver is the largest organ inside your body. It helps your body digest food, store energy, and remove poisons.

Title: Liver Transplantation
Condensed Summary: Your liver is the largest organ inside your body. It helps your body digest food, store energy, and remove poisons.

Title: Living with HIV
Condensed Summary: What are HIV and AIDS? HIV stands for human immunodeficiency virus.

Title: Low Blood Pressure
Condensed Summary: You've probably heard that high blood pressure is a problem. Sometimes blood pressure that is too low can also cause problems.

Title: Lung Cancer
Condensed Summary: What is lung cancer? Lung cancer is cancer that forms in tissues of the lung, usually in the cells that line the air passages.

Title: Lung Diseases
Condensed Summary: When you breathe, your lungs take in oxygen from the air and deliver it to the bloodstream. The cells in your body need oxygen to work and grow.

Title: Lung Transplantation
Condensed Summary: A lung transplant removes a person's diseased lung and replaces it with a healthy one. The healthy lung comes from a donor who has died.

Title: Lupus
Also Called: Discoid lupus, SLE, Subacute cutaneous lupus, Systemic lupus erythematosus
Condensed Summary: What is lupus? Lupus is an autoimmune disease.

Title: Lyme Disease
Condensed Summary: What is Lyme disease? Lyme disease is a bacterial infection you get from the bite of an infected tick.

Title: Lymphatic Diseases
Condensed Summary: The lymphatic system is a network of tissues and organs. It is made up of: Lymph - a fluid that contains white blood cells that defend against germs Lymph vessels - vessels that carry lymph throughout your body.

Title: Lymphedema
Condensed Summary: Lymphedema is the name of a type of swelling. It happens when lymph builds up in your body's soft tissues.

Title: Lymphoma
Condensed Summary: Lymphoma is a cancer of a part of the immune system called the lymph system. There are many types of lymphoma.

Title: Macular Degeneration
Condensed Summary: Macular degeneration, or age-related macular degeneration (AMD), is a leading cause of vision loss in Americans 60 and older. It is a disease that destroys your sharp, central vision.

Title: Malabsorption Syndromes
Condensed Summary: Your small intestine does most of the digesting of the foods you eat. If you have a malabsorption syndrome, your small intestine cannot absorb nutrients from foods.

Title: Malaria
Condensed Summary: Malaria is a serious disease caused by a parasite. You get it when an infected mosquito bites you.

Title: Male Breast Cancer
Condensed Summary: Although breast cancer is much more common in women, men can get it too. It happens most often to men between the ages of 60 and 70.

Title: Male Infertility
Condensed Summary: Infertility is a term doctors use if a man hasn't been able to get a woman pregnant after at least one year of trying. Causes of male infertility include: Physical problems with the testicles Blockages in the ducts that carry sperm Hormone problems A history of high fevers or mumps Genetic disorders Lifestyle or environmental factors About a third of the time, infertility is because of a problem with the man.

Title: Mammography
Condensed Summary: What is a mammogram? A mammogram is an x-ray picture of the breast.

Title: Marfan Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Marfan syndrome is a disorder that affects connective tissue. Connective tissues are proteins that support skin, bones, blood vessels, and other organs.

Title: Marijuana
Also Called: Cannabis, Ganja, Grass, Hash, Pot, Weed
Condensed Summary: What is marijuana? Marijuana is a green, brown, or gray mix of dried, crumbled parts from the marijuana plant.

Title: Mastectomy
Condensed Summary: A mastectomy is surgery to remove a breast or part of a breast. It is usually done to treat breast cancer.

Title: Measles
Condensed Summary: Measles is an infectious disease caused by a virus. It spreads easily from person to person.

Title: Medicare
Condensed Summary: Medicare is the U.S. government's health insurance program for people age 65 or older. Some people under age 65 can qualify for Medicare, too.

Title: Medication Errors
Condensed Summary: Medicines treat infectious diseases, prevent problems from chronic diseases, and ease pain. But medicines can also cause harmful reactions if not used correctly.

Title: Medicines
Condensed Summary: Medicines can treat diseases and improve your health. If you are like most people, you need to take medicine at some point in your life.

Title: Medicines and Children
Condensed Summary: Children aren't just small adults. It is especially important to remember this when giving medicines to children.

Title: Melanoma
Condensed Summary: Melanoma is the most serious type of skin cancer. Often the first sign of melanoma is a change in the size, shape, color, or feel of a mole.

Title: Memory
Condensed Summary: Every day, you have different experiences and you learn new things. Your brain cannot store all of that information, so it has to decide what is worth remembering.

Title: Men's Health
Condensed Summary: Most men need to pay more attention to their health. Compared to women, men are more likely to: Smoke and drink Make unhealthy or risky choices Put off regular checkups and medical care There are also health conditions that only affect men, such as prostate cancer and low testosterone.

Title: Meniere's Disease
Condensed Summary: Meniere's disease is a disorder of the inner ear. It can cause severe dizziness, a roaring sound in your ears called tinnitus, hearing loss that comes and goes and the feeling of ear pressure or pain.

Title: Meningitis
Condensed Summary: Meningitis is inflammation of the thin tissue that surrounds the brain and spinal cord, called the meninges. There are several types of meningitis.

Title: Meningococcal Infections
Condensed Summary: Meningococci are a type of bacteria that cause serious infections. The most common infection is meningitis, which is an inflammation of the thin tissue that surrounds the brain and spinal cord.

Title: Menopause
Condensed Summary: Menopause is the time in a woman's life when her period stops. It usually occurs naturally, most often after age 45.

Title: Menstruation
Condensed Summary: Menstruation, or period, is normal vaginal bleeding that occurs as part of a woman's monthly cycle. Every month, your body prepares for pregnancy.

Title: Mental Disorders
Condensed Summary: What are mental disorders? Mental disorders (or mental illnesses) are conditions that affect your thinking, feeling, mood, and behavior.

Title: Mental Health
Condensed Summary: What is mental health? Mental health includes our emotional, psychological, and social well-being.

Title: Mercury
Condensed Summary: Mercury is an element that is found in air, water and soil. It has several forms.

Title: Mesothelioma
Condensed Summary: The tissue that lines your lungs, stomach, heart, and other organs is called mesothelium. Mesothelioma, also known as malignant mesothelioma, is cancer of that tissue.

Title: Metabolic Disorders
Condensed Summary: Metabolism is the process your body uses to get or make energy from the food you eat. Food is made up of proteins, carbohydrates, and fats.

Title: Metabolic Syndrome
Also Called: Insulin resistance syndrome, Metabolic syndrome X
Condensed Summary: What is metabolic syndrome? Metabolic syndrome is the name for a group of risk factors for heart disease, diabetes, and other health problems.

Title: Methamphetamine
Also Called: Chalk, Crystal, Glass, Ice, Meth, Speed, Tina
Condensed Summary: Methamphetamine - meth for short - is a very addictive stimulant drug. It is a powder that can be made into a pill or a shiny rock (called a crystal).

Title: Migraine
Condensed Summary: What are migraines? Migraines are a recurring type of headache.

Title: Mild Cognitive Impairment
Condensed Summary: Some forgetfulness can be a normal part of aging. However, some people have more memory problems than other people their age.

Title: Miscarriage
Condensed Summary: A miscarriage is an unexpected loss of pregnancy before the 20th week of pregnancy. Most miscarriages happen very early in the pregnancy, often before a woman even knows she is pregnant.

Title: Mitochondrial Diseases
Condensed Summary: Metabolism is the process your body uses to make energy from the food you eat. Food is made up of proteins, carbohydrates, and fats.

Title: Mitral Valve Prolapse
Also Called: Barlow's syndrome, Floppy valve syndrome, MVP
Condensed Summary: What is the mitral valve? The mitral valve is one of the four valves in your heart.

Title: Molds
Condensed Summary: Molds are fungi that can be found both outdoors and indoors. They grow best in warm, damp and humid conditions.

Title: Moles
Condensed Summary: Moles are growths on the skin. They happen when pigment cells in the skin, called melanocytes, grow in clusters.

Title: Mood Disorders
Condensed Summary: Most people feel sad or irritable from time to time. They may say they're in a bad mood.

Title: Mosquito Bites
Condensed Summary: Mosquitoes are insects that live all over the world. There are thousands of different species of mosquitoes; about 200 of those live in the United States.

Title: Motion Sickness
Condensed Summary: Motion sickness is a common problem in people traveling by car, train, airplanes, and especially boats. Anyone can get it, but it is more common in children, pregnant women, and people taking certain medicines.

Title: Mouth Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your mouth is one of the most important parts of your body. It has many different functions.

Title: Movement Disorders
Condensed Summary: Movement disorders are neurologic conditions that cause problems with movement, such as: Increased movement that can be voluntary (intentional) or involuntary (unintended) Decreased or slow voluntary movement There are many different movement disorders. Some of the more common types include: Ataxia, the loss of muscle coordination Dystonia, in which involuntary contractions of your muscles cause twisting and repetitive movements.

Title: Mpox
Condensed Summary: What is mpox? Mpox, which used to be called monkeypox, is a rare disease caused by infection with the mpox virus.

Title: MRI Scans
Also Called: Magnetic resonance imaging, NMR, Nuclear magnetic resonance
Condensed Summary: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) uses a large magnet and radio waves to look at organs and structures inside your body. Health care professionals use MRI scans to diagnose a variety of conditions, from torn ligaments to tumors.

Title: MRSA
Condensed Summary: MRSA stands for methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus. It causes a staph infection (pronounced "staff infection") that is resistant to several common antibiotics.

Title: Multiple Myeloma
Condensed Summary: Multiple myeloma is a cancer that begins in plasma cells, a type of white blood cell. These cells are part of your immune system, which helps protect the body from germs and other harmful substances.

Title: Multiple Sclerosis
Condensed Summary: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a nervous system disease that affects your brain and spinal cord. It damages the myelin sheath, the material that surrounds and protects your nerve cells.

Title: Mumps
Condensed Summary: Mumps is an illness caused by the mumps virus. It starts with: Fever Headache Muscle aches Tiredness Loss of appetite After that, the salivary glands under the ears or jaw become swollen and tender.

Title: Muscle Cramps
Condensed Summary: What are muscle cramps? Muscle cramps are sudden, involuntary contractions or spasms in one or more of your muscles.

Title: Muscle Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your muscles help you move and help your body work. Different types of muscles have different jobs.

Title: Muscular Dystrophy
Condensed Summary: What is muscular dystrophy (MD)? Muscular dystrophy (MD) is a group of more than 30 genetic diseases.

Title: Myasthenia Gravis
Condensed Summary: Myasthenia gravis is a disease that causes weakness in your voluntary muscles. These are the muscles that you control.

Title: Mycobacterial Infections
Condensed Summary: Mycobacteria are a type of germ. There are many different kinds.

Title: Myelodysplastic Syndromes
Condensed Summary: Your bone marrow is the spongy tissue inside some of your bones, such as your hip and thigh bones. It contains immature cells, called stem cells.

Title: Myositis
Condensed Summary: Myositis means inflammation of the muscles that you use to move your body. An injury, infection, or autoimmune disease can cause it.

Title: Nail Diseases
Condensed Summary: Your toenails and fingernails protect the tissues of your toes and fingers. They are made up of layers of a hardened protein called keratin, which is also in your hair and skin.

Title: Nasal Cancer
Also Called: Cancer of the nasal cavity, Cancer of the paranasal sinus
Condensed Summary: Your paranasal sinuses are small hollow spaces around the nose. They are lined with cells that make mucus, which keeps your nose from drying out.

Title: Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander Health
Condensed Summary: Every racial or ethnic group has specific health concerns. Differences in the health of groups can result from: Genetics Environmental factors Access to care Cultural factors On this page, you'll find links to health issues that affect Native Hawaiians and Pacific Islanders.

Title: Nausea and Vomiting
Condensed Summary: What are nausea and vomiting? Nausea is when you feel sick to your stomach, as if you are going to throw up.

Title: Neck Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Any part of your neck - muscles, bones, joints, tendons, ligaments, or nerves - can cause neck problems. Neck pain is very common.

Title: Neural Tube Defects
Condensed Summary: Neural tube defects are birth defects of the brain, spine, or spinal cord. They happen in the first month of pregnancy, often before a woman even knows that she is pregnant.

Title: Neuroblastoma
Condensed Summary: What is neuroblastoma? Neuroblastoma is a type of cancer that forms in nerve cells called neuroblasts.

Title: Neurofibromatosis
Condensed Summary: Neurofibromatosis is a genetic disorder of the nervous system. It mainly affects how nerve cells form and grow.

Title: Neurologic Diseases
Condensed Summary: The brain, spinal cord, and nerves make up the nervous system. Together they control all the workings of the body.

Title: Neuromuscular Disorders
Condensed Summary: Neuromuscular disorders affect your neuromuscular system. They can cause problems with: The nerves that control your muscles Your muscles Communication between your nerves and muscles These disorders can cause your muscles to become weak and waste away.

Title: Newborn Screening
Condensed Summary: Your newborn infant has screening tests before leaving the hospital. There may be different tests depending on the state where you live.

Title: Noise
Condensed Summary: Noise is all around you, from televisions and radios to lawn mowers and washing machines. Normally, you hear these sounds at safe levels that don't affect hearing.

Title: Non-Drug Pain Management
Condensed Summary: What is pain? Pain is a signal in your nervous system that something may be wrong.

Title: Norovirus Infections
Condensed Summary: Noroviruses are a group of related viruses. Infection with these viruses causes an illness called gastroenteritis, an inflammation of the stomach and intestines.

Title: Nose Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your nose is important to your health. It filters the air you breathe, removing dust, germs, and irritants.

Title: Nuclear Scans
Condensed Summary: Nuclear scans use radioactive substances to see structures and functions inside your body. They use a special camera that detects radioactivity.

Title: Nursing Homes
Condensed Summary: A nursing home is a place for people who don't need to be in a hospital but can't be cared for at home. Most nursing homes have nursing aides and skilled nurses on hand 24 hours a day.

Title: Nutrition for Older Adults
Condensed Summary: What is nutrition and why is it important for older adults? Nutrition is about eating a healthy and balanced diet so your body gets the nutrients that it needs.

Title: Obesity
Condensed Summary: Obesity means having too much body fat. It is different from being overweight, which means weighing too much.

Title: Obesity in Children
Condensed Summary: Obesity means having too much body fat. It is different from being overweight, which means weighing too much.

Title: Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder
Condensed Summary: What is obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD)? Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) is a mental disorder in which you have thoughts (obsessions) and rituals (compulsions) over and over.

Title: Oil Spills
Condensed Summary: Oil spills often happen because of accidents, when people make mistakes or equipment breaks down. Other causes include natural disasters or deliberate acts.

Title: Older Adult Health
Condensed Summary: People in the U.S. are living longer than ever before. Many older adults live active and healthy lives.

Title: Older Adult Mental Health
Condensed Summary: Mental health includes our emotional, psychological, and social well-being. It affects how we think, feel, and act as we cope with life.

Title: Opioid Overdose
Condensed Summary: What are opioids? Opioids, sometimes called narcotics, are a type of drug.

Title: Opioid Use Disorder (OUD) Treatment
Also Called: Medications for opioid use disorder (MOUD), Opioid abuse and addiction treatment
Condensed Summary: What are opioids? Opioids, sometimes called narcotics, are a type of drug.

Title: Opioids and Opioid Use Disorder (OUD)
Also Called: Opioid abuse, Opioid addiction, Opioid misuse
Condensed Summary: What are opioids? Opioids, sometimes called narcotics, are a type of drug.

Title: Optic Nerve Disorders
Condensed Summary: The optic nerve is a bundle of more than 1 million nerve fibers that carry visual messages. You have one connecting the back of each eye (your retina) to your brain.

Title: Oral Cancer
Condensed Summary: What is oral cancer? Oral cancer is cancer of the mouth.

Title: Organ Donation
Condensed Summary: Organ donation takes healthy organs and tissues from one person for transplantation into another. Experts say that the organs from one donor can save or help as many as 50 people.

Title: Organ Transplantation
Condensed Summary: You may need an organ transplant if one of your organs has failed. This can happen because of illness or injury.

Title: Orthodontia
Condensed Summary: Some people have naturally straight teeth that fit together. But if you have problems with your bite or the spacing of your teeth, you may need orthodontic care.

Title: Osteoarthritis
Condensed Summary: What is osteoarthritis? Osteoarthritis, sometimes called OA, is a type of arthritis that only affects the joints, usually in the hands, knees, hips, neck, and lower back.

Title: Osteogenesis Imperfecta
Condensed Summary: Osteogenesis imperfecta (OI) is a genetic disorder in which bones fracture (break) easily. Sometimes the fractures happen for no known reason.

Title: Osteonecrosis
Also Called: Aseptic necrosis, Avascular necrosis, Ischemic necrosis
Condensed Summary: Osteonecrosis is a disease caused by reduced blood flow to bones in the joints. In people with healthy bones, new bone is always replacing old bone.

Title: Osteoporosis
Condensed Summary: Osteoporosis is a disease that thins and weakens the bones. Your bones become fragile and fracture (break) easily, especially the bones in the hip, spine, and wrist.

Title: Ostomy
Condensed Summary: An ostomy is surgery to create an opening (stoma) from an area inside the body to the outside. It treats certain diseases of the digestive or urinary systems.

Title: Ovarian Cancer
Condensed Summary: What is ovarian cancer? Cancer is a disease in which abnormal cells in the body grow out of control and form a tumor.

Title: Ovarian Cysts
Condensed Summary: The ovaries are part of the female reproductive system. They produce a woman's eggs and make female hormones.

Title: Ovarian Disorders
Condensed Summary: The ovaries are part of the female reproductive system. Women have two ovaries, one on each side of the uterus.

Title: Over-the-Counter Medicines
Condensed Summary: Over-the-counter (OTC) medicines are drugs you can buy without a prescription. Some OTC medicines relieve aches, pains, and itches.

Title: Overactive Bladder
Condensed Summary: Overactive bladder is a condition in which the bladder squeezes urine out at the wrong time. You may have overactive bladder if you have two or more of these symptoms: You urinate eight or more times a day or two or more times at night You have the sudden, strong need to urinate immediately You leak urine after a sudden, strong urge to urinate You also may have incontinence, a loss of bladder control.

Title: Oxygen Therapy
Condensed Summary: What is oxygen? Oxygen is a gas that your body needs to work properly.

Title: Ozone
Condensed Summary: Ozone is a gas. It can be good or bad, depending on where it is.

Title: Pacemakers and Implantable Defibrillators
Condensed Summary: An arrhythmia is any disorder of your heart rate or rhythm. It means that your heart beats too quickly, too slowly, or with an irregular pattern.

Title: Paget's Disease of Bone
Condensed Summary: What is Paget's disease of bone? Paget's disease of bone is a chronic bone disorder.

Title: Pain
Condensed Summary: Pain is a signal in your nervous system that something may be wrong. It is an unpleasant feeling, such as a prick, tingle, sting, burn, or ache.

Title: Pain Relievers
Condensed Summary: Pain relievers are medicines that reduce or relieve headaches, sore muscles, arthritis, or other aches and pains. There are many different pain medicines, and each one has advantages and risks.

Title: Pancreas Transplantation
Condensed Summary: The pancreas is a gland behind your stomach and in front of your spine. It produces the juices that help break down food and the hormones that help control blood sugar levels.

Title: Pancreatic Cancer
Condensed Summary: The pancreas is a gland behind your stomach and in front of your spine. It produces the juices that help break down food and the hormones that help control blood sugar levels.

Title: Pancreatic Diseases
Condensed Summary: The pancreas is a gland behind your stomach and in front of your spine. It produces juices that help break down food and hormones that help control blood sugar levels.

Title: Pancreatitis
Condensed Summary: The pancreas is a large gland behind the stomach and close to the first part of the small intestine. It secretes digestive juices into the small intestine through a tube called the pancreatic duct.

Title: Panic Disorder
Condensed Summary: Panic disorder is a type of anxiety disorder. It causes panic attacks, which are sudden feelings of terror when there is no real danger.

Title: Paralysis
Condensed Summary: Paralysis is the loss of muscle function in part of your body. It happens when something goes wrong with the way messages pass between your brain and muscles.

Title: Parasitic Diseases
Condensed Summary: Parasites are living things that use other living things - like your body - for food and a place to live. You can get them from contaminated food or water, a bug bite, or sexual contact.

Title: Parathyroid Disorders
Condensed Summary: Most people have four pea-sized glands, called parathyroid glands, on the thyroid gland in the neck. Though their names are similar, the thyroid and parathyroid glands are completely different.

Title: Parenting
Condensed Summary: If you're a parent, you get plenty of suggestions on how to raise your child. From experts to other parents, people are always ready to offer advice.

Title: Parkinson's Disease
Condensed Summary: Parkinson's disease (PD) is a type of movement disorder. It happens when nerve cells in the brain don't produce enough of a brain chemical called dopamine.

Title: Pelvic Floor Disorders
Condensed Summary: The pelvic floor is a group of muscles and other tissues that form a sling or hammock across the pelvis. In women, it holds the uterus, bladder, bowel, and other pelvic organs in place so that they can work properly.

Title: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease
Condensed Summary: Pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) is an infection and inflammation of the uterus, ovaries, and other female reproductive organs. It causes scarring in these organs.

Title: Pelvic Pain
Condensed Summary: Pelvic pain occurs mostly in the lower abdomen area. The pain might be steady, or it might come and go.

Title: Pemphigus
Condensed Summary: Pemphigus is an autoimmune disorder. If you have it, your immune system attacks healthy cells in your skin and mouth, causing blisters and sores.

Title: Penis Disorders
Condensed Summary: Problems with the penis can cause pain and affect a man's sexual function and fertility. Penis disorders include: Erectile dysfunction - inability to get or keep an erection Priapism - a painful erection that does not go away Peyronie's disease - bending of the penis during an erection due to a hard lump called a plaque Balanitis - inflammation of the skin covering the head of the penis, most often in men and boys who have not been circumcised Penile cancer - a rare form of cancer, highly curable when caught early

Title: Peptic Ulcer
Also Called: Duodenal ulcer, Gastric ulcer, Stomach ulcer, Ulcer
Condensed Summary: A peptic ulcer is a sore in the lining of your stomach or your duodenum, the first part of your small intestine. A burning stomach pain is the most common symptom.

Title: Pericardial Disorders
Condensed Summary: The pericardium is a membrane, or sac, that surrounds your heart. It holds the heart in place and helps it work properly.

Title: Period Pain
Condensed Summary: What are painful periods? Menstruation, or period, is normal vaginal bleeding that happens as part of a woman's monthly cycle.

Title: Peripheral Arterial Disease
Condensed Summary: Peripheral arterial disease (PAD) happens when there is a narrowing of the blood vessels outside of your heart. The cause of PAD is atherosclerosis.

Title: Peripheral Nerve Disorders
Condensed Summary: What are peripheral nerves? Nerves are like wires that carry messages back and forth between your brain and your body.

Title: Peritoneal Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your peritoneum is the tissue that lines your abdominal wall and covers most of the organs in your abdomen. A liquid, peritoneal fluid, lubricates the surface of this tissue.

Title: Personality Disorders
Condensed Summary: What is personality? Your personality is your own way of thinking, feeling, behaving, and relating to others.

Title: Pesticides
Condensed Summary: Pests live where they are not wanted or cause harm to crops, people, or animals. Pesticides can help get rid of them.

Title: Phenylketonuria
Condensed Summary: Phenylketonuria (PKU) is a type of amino acid metabolism disorder. It is inherited.

Title: Pheochromocytoma
Condensed Summary: Pheochromocytoma is a rare tumor that usually starts in the cells of one of your adrenal glands. Although they are usually benign, pheochromocytomas often cause the adrenal gland to make too many hormones.

Title: Phobias
Condensed Summary: A phobia is a type of anxiety disorder. It is a strong, irrational fear of something that poses little or no real danger.

Title: Piercing and Tattoos
Condensed Summary: Piercings and tattoos are body decorations that go back to ancient times. Body piercing involves making a hole in the skin so that you can insert jewelry.

Title: Pink Eye
Condensed Summary: Conjunctivitis is the medical name for pink eye. It involves inflammation of the outer layer of the eye and inside of the eyelid.

Title: Pinworms
Also Called: Enterobiasis, Oxyuriasis, Seatworm infection, Threadworm infection
Condensed Summary: Pinworms are small parasites that can live in the colon and rectum. You get them when you swallow their eggs.

Title: Pituitary Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your pituitary gland is a pea-sized gland at the base of your brain. The pituitary is the "master control gland" - it makes hormones that affect growth and the functions of other glands in the body.

Title: Pituitary Tumors
Condensed Summary: Your pituitary gland is a pea-sized gland at the base of your brain. The pituitary is the "master control gland" - it makes hormones that affect growth and the functions of other glands in the body.

Title: Plague
Condensed Summary: Plague is an infection caused by the bacterium Yersinia pestis. The bacteria are found mainly in rats and in the fleas that feed on them.

Title: Plastic and Cosmetic Surgery
Condensed Summary: Surgeons can reshape the appearance of body parts through cosmetic surgery. Some of the most common body parts people want to improve through surgery include: Breasts: Increase or reduce the size of breasts or reshape sagging breasts Ears: Reduce the size of large ears or set protruding ears back closer to the head Eyes: Correct drooping upper eyelids or remove puffy bags below the eyes Face: Remove facial wrinkles, creases or acne scars Hair: Fill in balding areas with one's own hair Nose: Change the shape of the nose Tummy: Flatten the abdomen
Physician: Orthopedic Surgery, Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Title: Platelet Disorders
Condensed Summary: Platelets, also known as thrombocytes, are blood cells. They form in your bone marrow, a sponge-like tissue in your bones.

Title: Pleural Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your pleura is a large, thin sheet of tissue that wraps around the outside of your lungs and lines the inside of your chest cavity. Between the layers of the pleura is a very thin space.

Title: Pneumococcal Infections
Condensed Summary: Pneumococci are a type of streptococcus bacteria. The bacteria spread through contact with people who are ill or by healthy people who carry the bacteria in the back of their nose.

Title: Pneumocystis Infections
Condensed Summary: Pneumocystis jirovecii is a tiny fungus that lives in the lungs of many people. Most people's immune systems keep the fungus under control.

Title: Pneumonia
Condensed Summary: What is pneumonia? Pneumonia is an infection in one or both of the lungs.

Title: Poison Ivy, Oak, and Sumac
Also Called: Ivy poison, Rhus dermatitis, Toxicodendron dermatitis
Condensed Summary: If you spend time outdoors, chances are you have been bothered by poison ivy, poison oak or poison sumac at some point. Most people are sensitive to the plants' oily sap.

Title: Poisoning
Condensed Summary: A poison is any substance that is harmful to your body. You might swallow it, inhale it, inject it, or absorb it through your skin.

Title: Polio and Post-Polio Syndrome
Condensed Summary: What is polio? Polio, or poliomyelitis, is a disease that spreads from person to person.

Title: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) happens when a woman's ovaries or adrenal glands produce more male hormones than normal. PCOS causes cysts (fluid-filled sacs) to grow on the ovaries.

Title: Polymyalgia Rheumatica
Condensed Summary: Polymyalgia rheumatica is a disorder that causes muscle pain and stiffness in your neck, shoulders, and hips. It is most common in women and almost always occurs in people over 50.

Title: Porphyria
Condensed Summary: Porphyrias are a group of genetic disorders caused by problems with how your body makes a substance called heme. Heme is found throughout the body, especially in your blood and bone marrow, where it carries oxygen.

Title: Post-COVID Conditions (Long COVID)
Also Called: Chronic COVID, Long-haul COVID, Long-term effects of COVID
Condensed Summary: What are post-COVID conditions (long COVID)? COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019) is an illness caused by a virus.

Title: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder
Condensed Summary: What is post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)? Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) is a mental health disorder that some people develop after they experience or see a traumatic event.

Title: Postpartum Care
Condensed Summary: Taking home a new baby is one of the happiest times in a woman's life. But it also presents both physical and emotional challenges.

Title: Postpartum Depression
Condensed Summary: Many women have the baby blues after childbirth. If you have the baby blues, you may have mood swings, feel sad, anxious or overwhelmed, have crying spells, lose your appetite, or have trouble sleeping.

Title: Prader-Willi Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Prader-Willi Syndrome (PWS) is a rare genetic disorder. It causes poor muscle tone, low levels of sex hormones and a constant feeling of hunger.

Title: Preconception Care
Condensed Summary: If you are trying to have a baby or are just thinking about it, it is not too early to prepare for a safe pregnancy and a healthy baby. You should see your health care provider for preconception care.

Title: Prediabetes
Condensed Summary: What is prediabetes? Prediabetes means that your blood glucose, or blood sugar, levels are higher than normal but not high enough to be called diabetes.

Title: Pregnancy
Condensed Summary: You're going to have a baby! It's an exciting time, but it can also feel a bit overwhelming.

Title: Pregnancy and Medicines
Condensed Summary: Not all medicines are safe to take when you are pregnant. Some medicines can harm your baby.

Title: Pregnancy and Nutrition
Condensed Summary: What is nutrition, and why is it important during pregnancy? Nutrition is about eating a healthy and balanced diet so your body gets the nutrients that it needs.

Title: Pregnancy and Opioids
Condensed Summary: You may need to take medicines while you are pregnant. But not all medicines are safe during pregnancy.

Title: Pregnancy and Substance Use
Condensed Summary: During pregnancy, there are many things you can do to keep yourself and your baby healthy. They include getting regular prenatal care, eating healthy, and staying active.

Title: Premature Babies
Condensed Summary: Almost 1 of every 10 infants born in the United States are premature, or preemies. A premature birth is when a baby is born before 37 completed weeks of pregnancy.

Title: Premenstrual Syndrome
Condensed Summary: What is premenstrual syndrome (PMS)? Premenstrual syndrome, or PMS, is a group of physical and emotional symptoms that start one to two weeks before your period.

Title: Prenatal Care
Condensed Summary: Prenatal care is the health care you get while you are pregnant. It includes your checkups and prenatal testing.

Title: Prenatal Testing
Condensed Summary: Prenatal testing provides information about your baby's health before he or she is born. Some routine tests during pregnancy also check on your health.

Title: Prescription Drug Misuse
Condensed Summary: If you take a medicine in a way that is different from what the doctor prescribed, it is called prescription drug misuse. It could be: Taking a medicine that was prescribed for someone else Taking a larger dose than you are supposed to Taking the medicine in a different way than you are supposed to.

Title: Pressure Sores
Also Called: Bed sores, Decubitus ulcers, Pressure ulcers
Condensed Summary: Pressure sores are areas of damaged skin caused by staying in one position for too long. They commonly form where your bones are close to your skin, such as your ankles, back, elbows, heels and hips.

Title: Preterm Labor
Also Called: Early Labor, Premature Birth, Premature Labor, Preterm Birth
Condensed Summary: Preterm labor is labor that starts before 37 completed weeks of pregnancy. It can lead to premature birth.

Title: Primary Ovarian Insufficiency
Also Called: Ovarian insufficiency, POF, POI, Premature ovarian failure
Condensed Summary: What is primary ovarian insufficiency (POI)? Primary ovarian insufficiency (POI), also known as premature ovarian failure, happens when a woman's ovaries stop working normally before she is 40.

Title: Progressive Supranuclear Palsy
Condensed Summary: What is progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP)? Progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP) is a rare brain disease.

Title: Prostate Cancer
Condensed Summary: What is prostate cancer? Cancer is a disease in which cells in the body grow out of control.

Title: Prostate Cancer Screening
Condensed Summary: What is cancer screening? Cancer is a disease when the cells of the body grow out of control.

Title: Prostate Diseases
Condensed Summary: What is the prostate? The prostate is a gland in the male reproductive system.

Title: Psoriasis
Condensed Summary: Psoriasis is a skin disease that causes itchy or sore patches of thick, red skin with silvery scales. You usually get the patches on your elbows, knees, scalp, back, face, palms and feet, but they can show up on other parts of your body.

Title: Psoriatic Arthritis
Condensed Summary: Psoriasis is a skin disease that causes itchy or sore patches of thick, red skin with silvery scales. You usually get them on your elbows, knees, scalp, back, face, palms and feet, but they can show up on other parts of your body.

Title: Psychotic Disorders
Condensed Summary: Psychotic disorders are severe mental disorders that cause abnormal thinking and perceptions. People with psychoses lose touch with reality.

Title: Puberty
Condensed Summary: Puberty is the time in life when a boy or girl becomes sexually mature. It is a process that usually happens between ages 10 and 14 for girls and ages 12 and 16 for boys.

Title: Pubic Lice
Condensed Summary: What are pubic lice? Pubic lice (also called crabs) are tiny insects which usually live in the pubic or genital area of humans.

Title: Pulmonary Embolism
Condensed Summary: What is a pulmonary embolism (PE)? A pulmonary embolism (PE) is a sudden blockage in a lung artery.

Title: Pulmonary Fibrosis
Condensed Summary: Pulmonary fibrosis is a condition in which the tissue deep in your lungs becomes scarred over time. This tissue gets thick and stiff.

Title: Pulmonary Hypertension
Condensed Summary: Pulmonary hypertension (PH) is high blood pressure in the arteries to your lungs. It is a serious condition.

Title: Pulmonary Rehabilitation
Condensed Summary: What is pulmonary rehabilitation? Pulmonary rehabilitation, also known as pulmonary rehab or PR, is a program for people who have chronic (ongoing) breathing problems.

Title: Quitting Smoking
Condensed Summary: Tobacco use is the most common preventable cause of death. About half of the people who don't quit smoking will die of smoking-related problems.

Title: Rabies
Condensed Summary: Rabies is a deadly animal disease caused by a virus. It can happen in wild animals, including raccoons, skunks, bats and foxes, or in dogs, cats or farm animals.

Title: Radiation Exposure
Condensed Summary: What is radiation? Radiation is energy.

Title: Radiation Therapy
Condensed Summary: Radiation therapy is a cancer treatment. It uses high doses of radiation to kill cancer cells and stop them from spreading.

Title: Radon
Condensed Summary: You can't see radon. And you can't smell it or taste it.

Title: Rare Diseases
Condensed Summary: A rare disease is one that affects fewer than 200,000 people in the United States. There are nearly 7,000 rare diseases.

Title: Rashes
Condensed Summary: A rash is an area of irritated or swollen skin. Many rashes are itchy, red, painful, and irritated.

Title: Raynaud's Disease
Condensed Summary: Raynaud's disease is a rare disorder of the blood vessels, usually in the fingers and toes. It causes the blood vessels to narrow when you are cold or feeling stressed.

Title: Rectal Disorders
Condensed Summary: The rectum is the lower part of your large intestine where your body stores stool. Problems with rectum are common.

Title: Reflux in Children
Also Called: GER in Children, GERD in Children
Condensed Summary: What are reflux (GER) and GERD? The esophagus is the tube that carries food from your mouth to your stomach.

Title: Reflux in Infants
Also Called: GER in Infants, GERD in infants, Pediatric Gastroesophageal Reflux
Condensed Summary: What are reflux (GER) and GERD? The esophagus is the tube that carries food from your mouth to your stomach.

Title: Refractive Errors
Condensed Summary: The cornea and lens of your eye helps you focus. Refractive errors are vision problems that happen when the shape of the eye keeps you from focusing well.

Title: Rehabilitation
Condensed Summary: What is rehabilitation? Rehabilitation is care that can help you get back, keep, or improve abilities that you need for daily life.
Physician: Orthopedic Surgery, Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Title: Reproductive Hazards
Condensed Summary: What are reproductive hazards? Reproductive hazards are substances that affect the reproductive health of men or women.

Title: Respiratory Failure
Condensed Summary: What is respiratory failure? Respiratory failure is a condition in which your blood doesn't have enough oxygen or has too much carbon dioxide.

Title: Respiratory Syncytial Virus Infections
Condensed Summary: What is respiratory syncytial virus (RSV)? Respiratory syncytial virus, or RSV, is a common respiratory virus.

Title: Restless Legs
Condensed Summary: Restless legs syndrome (RLS) causes a powerful urge to move your legs. Your legs become uncomfortable when you are lying down or sitting.

Title: Retinal Detachment
Condensed Summary: The retina is a layer of tissue in the back of your eye that senses light and sends images to your brain. It provides the sharp, central vision needed for reading, driving, and seeing fine detail.

Title: Retinal Disorders
Condensed Summary: The retina is a layer of tissue in the back of your eye that senses light and sends images to your brain. In the center of this nerve tissue is the macula.

Title: Rett Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Rett syndrome is a rare genetic disease that causes developmental and nervous system problems, mostly in girls. It's related to autism spectrum disorder.

Title: Reye Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Reye syndrome is a rare illness that can affect the blood, liver, and brain of someone who has recently had a viral infection. It always follows another illness.

Title: Rh Incompatibility
Condensed Summary: There are four major blood types: A, B, O, and AB. The types are based on substances on the surface of the blood cells.

Title: Rheumatoid Arthritis
Condensed Summary: Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) is a form of arthritis that causes pain, swelling, stiffness and loss of function in your joints. It can affect any joint but is common in the wrist and fingers.

Title: Rickets
Condensed Summary: Rickets causes soft, weak bones in children. It usually occurs when they do not get enough vitamin D, which helps growing bones absorb the minerals calcium and phosphorous.

Title: Rosacea
Condensed Summary: Rosacea is a long-term disease that affects your skin and sometimes your eyes. It causes redness and pimples.

Title: Rotator Cuff Injuries
Condensed Summary: What is a rotator cuff? Your rotator cuff is part of your shoulder joint.

Title: Rotavirus Infections
Condensed Summary: Rotavirus is a virus that causes gastroenteritis. Symptoms include severe diarrhea, vomiting, fever, and dehydration.

Title: Rubella
Condensed Summary: Rubella is an infection caused by a virus. It is usually mild with fever and a rash.

Title: Safe Opioid Use
Condensed Summary: What are opioids? Opioids, sometimes called narcotics, are a type of drug.

Title: Salivary Gland Cancer
Condensed Summary: Your salivary glands make saliva - sometimes called spit - and empty it into your mouth through openings called ducts. Saliva makes your food moist, which helps you chew and swallow.

Title: Salivary Gland Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your salivary glands are in your mouth. You have three pairs of major salivary glands and hundreds of small (minor) glands.

Title: Salmonella Infections
Condensed Summary: Salmonella is the name of a group of bacteria. In the United States, it is a common cause of foodborne illness.

Title: Sarcoidosis
Condensed Summary: What is sarcoidosis? Sarcoidosis is a condition in which groups of cells in your immune system form small, red, and swollen (inflamed) lumps.

Title: Scabies
Condensed Summary: Scabies is an itchy skin condition caused by the microscopic mite Sarcoptes scabei. It is common all over the world, and can affect anyone.

Title: Scars
Condensed Summary: A scar is a permanent patch of skin that grows over a wound. It forms when your body heals itself after a cut, scrape, burn, or sore.

Title: Schizophrenia
Condensed Summary: Schizophrenia is a serious brain illness. People who have it may hear voices that aren't there.

Title: School Health
Condensed Summary: Your child spends more time at school than anywhere else except home. Schools can have a major effect on children's health.

Title: Sciatica
Condensed Summary: Sciatica is a symptom of a problem with the sciatic nerve, the largest nerve in the body. It controls muscles in the back of your knee and lower leg and provides feeling to the back of your thigh, part of your lower leg, and the sole of your foot.

Title: Scleroderma
Also Called: Circumscribed scleroderma, Dermatosclerosis, Morphea, Systemic sclerosis
Condensed Summary: Scleroderma means hard skin. It is a group of diseases that cause abnormal growth of connective tissue.

Title: Scoliosis
Condensed Summary: Scoliosis causes a sideways curve of your backbone, or spine. These curves are often S- or C-shaped.

Title: Seasonal Affective Disorder
Also Called: SAD, Seasonal depression, Seasonal mood disorder
Condensed Summary: Seasonal affective disorder (SAD) is a type of depression that comes and goes with the seasons. It usually starts in the late fall and early winter and goes away during the spring and summer.

Title: Secondhand Smoke
Also Called: Environmental tobacco smoke, Passive smoking, Tobacco smoke pollution
Condensed Summary: Secondhand smoke is a mixture of the smoke that comes from the burning end of a cigarette, cigar, or pipe, and the smoke breathed out by the smoker. It contains more than 7,000 chemicals.

Title: Seizures
Condensed Summary: Seizures are symptoms of a brain problem. They happen because of sudden, abnormal electrical activity in the brain.

Title: Self-Harm
Condensed Summary: What is self-harm? Self-harm, or self-injury, is when a person hurts his or her own body on purpose.

Title: Sepsis
Condensed Summary: What is sepsis? Sepsis is your body's overactive and extreme response to an infection.

Title: Sexual Assault
Condensed Summary: What is sexual assault? Sexual assault is any kind of sexual activity, contact, or experience that happens without your consent.

Title: Sexual Health
Condensed Summary: Sexuality is a big part of being human. Love, affection and sexual intimacy all play a role in healthy relationships.

Title: Sexual Problems in Men
Condensed Summary: Many men have sexual problems. They become more common as men age.

Title: Sexual Problems in Women
Condensed Summary: There are many problems that can keep a woman from enjoying sex. They include: Lack of sexual desire Inability to become aroused Lack of orgasm, or sexual climax Painful intercourse These problems may have physical or psychological causes.

Title: Sexually Transmitted Diseases
Also Called: STDs, Sexually transmitted infections, Venereal disease
Condensed Summary: What are sexually transmitted diseases (STDs)? Sexually transmitted diseases (STDs), or sexually transmitted infections (STIs), are infections that are passed from one person to another through sexual contact.

Title: Shingles
Condensed Summary: What is shingles? Shingles (herpes zoster) is an infection that causes a painful rash.

Title: Shock
Condensed Summary: Shock happens when not enough blood and oxygen can get to your organs and tissues. It causes very low blood pressure and may be life-threatening.

Title: Shoulder Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your shoulder joint is composed of three bones: the clavicle (collarbone), the scapula (shoulder blade), and the humerus (upper arm bone). Your shoulders are the most movable joints in your body.

Title: Sickle Cell Disease
Also Called: Hemoglobin SS disease, Sickle cell anemia
Condensed Summary: What is sickle cell disease (SCD)? Sickle cell disease (SCD) is a group of inherited red blood cell disorders.

Title: Sinusitis
Condensed Summary: Sinusitis means your sinuses are inflamed. The cause can be an infection or another problem.

Title: Sjogren's Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Sjogren's syndrome is an autoimmune disease. This means that your immune system attacks parts of your own body by mistake.

Title: Skin Aging
Condensed Summary: Your skin changes as you age. You might notice wrinkles, age spots and dryness.

Title: Skin Cancer
Condensed Summary: Skin cancer is the most common form of cancer in the United States. The two most common types are basal cell cancer and squamous cell cancer.

Title: Skin Conditions
Condensed Summary: What does your skin do? Your skin is your body's largest organ.

Title: Skin Infections
Condensed Summary: What are skin infections? Your skin is your body's largest organ.

Title: Skin Pigmentation Disorders
Condensed Summary: Pigmentation means coloring. Skin pigmentation disorders affect the color of your skin.

Title: Sleep Apnea
Condensed Summary: Sleep apnea is a common disorder that causes your breathing to stop or get very shallow. Breathing pauses can last from a few seconds to minutes.

Title: Sleep Disorders
Condensed Summary: What is sleep? Sleep is a complex biological process.

Title: Small Intestine Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your small intestine is the longest part of your digestive system - about twenty feet long! It connects your stomach to your large intestine (or colon) and folds many times to fit inside your abdomen.

Title: Smallpox
Condensed Summary: Smallpox is a disease caused by the Variola major virus. Some experts say that over the centuries it has killed more people than all other infectious diseases combined.

Title: Smokeless Tobacco
Also Called: Chewing tobacco, Dip, Oral tobacco, Snuff, Spit tobacco
Condensed Summary: Many people who chew tobacco or dip snuff think it's safer than smoking. But you don't have to smoke tobacco for it to be dangerous.

Title: Smoking
Also Called: Cigar smoking, Cigarette smoking, Pipe smoking, Tobacco smoking
Condensed Summary: What are the health effects of smoking? There's no way around it; smoking is bad for your health.

Title: Smoking and Youth
Condensed Summary: Smoking cigarettes has many health risks for everyone. However, the younger you are when you start smoking, the more problems it can cause.

Title: Snoring
Condensed Summary: Snoring is the sound you make when your breathing is blocked while you are asleep. The sound is caused by tissues at the top of your airway that strike each other and vibrate.

Title: Soft Tissue Sarcoma
Condensed Summary: Your soft tissues connect, support, or surround other tissues. Examples include your muscles, tendons, fat, and blood vessels.

Title: Sore Throat
Condensed Summary: Your throat is a tube that carries food to your esophagus and air to your windpipe and larynx (also called the voice box). The technical name for the throat is pharynx.

Title: Speech and Communication Disorders
Condensed Summary: Many disorders can affect our ability to speak and communicate. They range from saying sounds incorrectly to being completely unable to speak or understand speech.

Title: Speech and Language Problems in Children
Condensed Summary: Children vary in their development of speech and language skills. Health care professionals have lists of milestones for what's normal.

Title: Spider Bites
Condensed Summary: Though many people are afraid of spiders, they rarely bite people unless threatened. Most spider bites are harmless.

Title: Spina Bifida
Condensed Summary: Spina bifida is a neural tube defect - a type of birth defect of the brain, spine, or spinal cord. It happens if the spinal column of the fetus doesn't close completely during the first month of pregnancy.

Title: Spinal Cord Diseases
Condensed Summary: Your spinal cord is a bundle of nerves that runs down the middle of your back. It carries signals back and forth between your body and your brain.

Title: Spinal Cord Injuries
Condensed Summary: Your spinal cord is a bundle of nerves that runs down the middle of your back. It carries signals back and forth between your body and your brain.

Title: Spinal Muscular Atrophy
Condensed Summary: What is spinal muscular atrophy (SMA)? Spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) is a group of genetic diseases that damages and kills motor neurons.

Title: Spinal Stenosis
Condensed Summary: Your spine, or backbone, protects your spinal cord and allows you to stand and bend. Spinal stenosis causes narrowing in your spine.

Title: Spine Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your backbone, or spine, is made up of 26 bone discs called vertebrae. The vertebrae protect your spinal cord and allow you to stand and bend.

Title: Spleen Diseases
Condensed Summary: Your spleen is an organ above your stomach and under your ribs on your left side. It is about as big as your fist.

Title: Sports Injuries
Condensed Summary: Exercising is good for you, but sometimes you can injure yourself when you play sports or exercise. Accidents, poor training practices, or improper gear can cause them.

Title: Sprains and Strains
Condensed Summary: A sprain is a stretched or torn ligament. Ligaments are tissues that connect bones at a joint.

Title: Staphylococcal Infections
Condensed Summary: What are Staphylococcal (staph) infections? Staphylococcus (staph) is a group of bacteria.

Title: Statins
Condensed Summary: Statins are drugs used to lower cholesterol. Your body needs some cholesterol to work properly.

Title: Stem Cells
Condensed Summary: Stem cells are cells with the potential to develop into many different types of cells in the body. They serve as a repair system for the body.

Title: Steroids
Condensed Summary: You may have heard of anabolic steroids, which can have harmful effects. But there's another type of steroid - sometimes called a corticosteroid - that treats a variety of problems.

Title: Stillbirth
Condensed Summary: If a woman loses a pregnancy after she's past her 20th week, it's called a stillbirth. Stillbirths are due to natural causes.

Title: Stomach Cancer
Condensed Summary: The stomach is an organ between the esophagus and the small intestine. It mixes food with stomach acid and helps digest protein.

Title: Stomach Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your stomach is an organ between your esophagus and small intestine. It is where digestion of protein begins.

Title: Streptococcal Infections
Condensed Summary: Strep is short for Streptococcus, a type of bacteria. There are several types.

Title: Stress
Condensed Summary: What is stress? Stress is how your brain and body respond to a challenge or demand.

Title: Stroke
Condensed Summary: What is a stroke? A stroke happens when there is a loss of blood flow to part of the brain.

Title: Stroke Rehabilitation
Condensed Summary: A stroke can cause lasting brain damage. People who survive a stroke need to relearn skills they lost because of the damage.

Title: Stuttering
Condensed Summary: What is stuttering? Stuttering is a speech disorder.

Title: Sudden Cardiac Arrest
Condensed Summary: What is sudden cardiac arrest (SCA)? Sudden cardiac arrest (SCA) is a condition in which the heart suddenly stops beating.

Title: Sudden Infant Death Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) is the sudden, unexplained death of an infant younger than one year old. Some people call SIDS "crib death" because many babies who die of SIDS are found in their cribs.

Title: Suicide
Condensed Summary: What is suicide? Suicide is the taking of one's own life.

Title: Sun Exposure
Condensed Summary: Ultraviolet (UV) rays are an invisible form of radiation. They can pass through your skin and damage your skin cells.

Title: Surgery
Condensed Summary: There are many reasons to have surgery. Some operations can relieve or prevent pain.
Physician: Orthopedic Surgery, Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation

Title: Swallowing Disorders
Condensed Summary: If you have a swallowing disorder, you may have difficulty or pain when swallowing. Some people cannot swallow at all.

Title: Sweat
Condensed Summary: Sweat is a clear, salty liquid produced by glands in your skin. Sweating is how your body cools itself.

Title: Syphilis
Condensed Summary: Syphilis is a sexually transmitted disease caused by bacteria. It infects the genital area, lips, mouth, or anus of both men and women.

Title: Syringomyelia
Condensed Summary: Syringomyelia is a rare disorder that causes a cyst to form in your spinal cord. This cyst, called a syrinx, gets bigger and longer over time, destroying part of the spinal cord.

Title: Tailbone Disorders
Condensed Summary: The tailbone is the small bone at the bottom of your backbone, or spine. Tailbone disorders include tailbone injuries, pain, infections, cysts and tumors.

Title: Tanning
Condensed Summary: Can a tan be healthy? Some people think that tanning gives them a healthy glow.

Title: Taste and Smell Disorders
Condensed Summary: Our senses of taste and smell give us great pleasure. Taste helps us enjoy food and beverages.

Title: Tay-Sachs Disease
