Condensed Summary: Tay-Sachs disease is a rare, inherited disease. It is a type of lipid metabolism disorder.

Title: Tears
Condensed Summary: You may only think of tears as those salty drops that fall from your eyes when you cry. Actually, your tears clean your eyes every time you blink.

Title: Teen Depression
Condensed Summary: What is depression in teens? Depression in teens (ages 13-17) is a serious medical illness.

Title: Teen Development
Condensed Summary: As a teenager, you go through many physical, mental, emotional, and social changes. The biggest change is puberty, the process of becoming sexually mature.

Title: Teen Health
Condensed Summary: As a teenager, you go through many changes. Your body is on its way to becoming its adult size.

Title: Teen Mental Health
Condensed Summary: Being a teenager is hard. You're under stress to be liked, do well in school, get along with your family, and make big decisions.

Title: Teen Sexual Health
Condensed Summary: What is teen sexual health? Teen sexual health is about how sex affects your physical and emotional health.

Title: Teen Violence
Condensed Summary: Teen violence refers to harmful behaviors that can start early and continue into young adulthood. The young person can be a victim, an offender, or a witness to the violence.

Title: Teenage Pregnancy
Condensed Summary: Most teenage girls don't plan to get pregnant, but many do. Teen pregnancies carry extra health risks to both the mother and the baby.

Title: Temporomandibular Joint Dysfunction
Condensed Summary: The temporomandibular joint (TMJ) connects your jaw to the side of your head. When it works well, it enables you to talk, chew, and yawn.

Title: Tendinitis
Condensed Summary: Tendons are flexible bands of tissue that connect muscles to bones. They help your muscles move your bones.

Title: Testicular Cancer
Condensed Summary: What is testicular cancer? Testicular cancer is a cancer that develops in the tissues of one or both testicles.

Title: Testicular Disorders
Condensed Summary: Testicles, or testes, make male hormones and sperm. They are two egg-shaped organs inside the scrotum, the loose sac of skin behind the penis.

Title: Tetanus
Condensed Summary: Tetanus is a serious illness caused by Clostridium bacteria. The bacteria live in soil, saliva, dust, and manure.

Title: Tetanus, Diphtheria, and Pertussis Vaccines
Also Called: DTaP, DTaP/Tdap/Td, Td, Td vaccination booster, Tdap, Tetanus booster
Condensed Summary: Tetanus, diphtheria, and pertussis (whooping cough) are serious bacterial infections. Tetanus causes painful tightening of the muscles, usually all over the body.

Title: Thalassemia
Condensed Summary: Thalassemias are inherited blood disorders. If you have one, your body makes fewer healthy red blood cells and less hemoglobin.

Title: Thoracic Outlet Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Thoracic outlet syndrome (TOS) causes pain in the shoulder, arm, and neck. It happens when the nerves or blood vessels just below your neck are compressed, or squeezed.

Title: Throat Cancer
Also Called: Hypopharyngeal cancer, Laryngeal cancer, Laryngopharyngeal cancer, Nasopharyngeal cancer, Oropharyngeal cancer, Pharyngeal cancer
Condensed Summary: Throat cancer is a type of head and neck cancer. Throat cancer has different names, depending on which part of the throat is affected.

Title: Throat Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your throat is a tube that carries food to your esophagus and air to your windpipe and larynx. The technical name for your throat is the pharynx.

Title: Thymus Cancer
Condensed Summary: The thymus is a small organ in your upper chest, under your breastbone. Before birth and during childhood, the thymus helps the body make a type of white blood cell.

Title: Thyroid Cancer
Condensed Summary: What is thyroid cancer? Thyroid cancer is a cancer that starts in the tissues of the thyroid.

Title: Thyroid Diseases
Condensed Summary: Your thyroid is a small, butterfly-shaped gland in the front of your neck. It makes hormones that control the way the body uses energy.

Title: Thyroid Tests
Condensed Summary: Your thyroid is a small, butterfly-shaped gland in the front of your neck. It makes hormones that control the way the body uses energy.

Title: Tick Bites
Condensed Summary: What are ticks? Ticks are small parasites.

Title: Tinea Infections
Condensed Summary: Tinea is the name of a group of diseases caused by a fungus. Types of tinea include ringworm, athlete's foot and jock itch.

Title: Tinnitus
Condensed Summary: Tinnitus is often described as a ringing in the ears. It also can sound like roaring, clicking, hissing, or buzzing.

Title: Toddler Development
Condensed Summary: Mastering new skills such as how to walk, talk, and use the potty are developmental milestones. It is exciting to watch your toddler learn new skills.

Title: Toddler Health
Condensed Summary: Most young children get sick. It is hard for parents to know what is serious.

Title: Toddler Nutrition
Condensed Summary: Food provides the energy and nutrients that young children need to be healthy. Toddlers are learning to feed themselves and to eat new foods.

Title: Toe Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Fourteen of the 26 bones in your feet are in your toes. The toes, particularly your big toe, help you move and keep your balance.

Title: Tongue Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your tongue helps you taste, swallow, and chew. You also use it to speak.

Title: Tonsillitis
Condensed Summary: What are tonsils? Tonsils are lumps of tissue at the back of the throat.

Title: Tooth Decay
Condensed Summary: What is tooth decay? Tooth decay is damage to a tooth's surface, or enamel.

Title: Tooth Disorders
Condensed Summary: What are teeth? Your teeth are made of a hard, bonelike material.

Title: Tourette Syndrome
Condensed Summary: If you have Tourette syndrome, you make unusual movements or sounds, called tics. You have little or no control over them.

Title: Toxoplasmosis
Condensed Summary: Toxoplasmosis is a disease caused by the parasite Toxoplasma gondii. More than 60 million people in the U.S. have the parasite.

Title: Tracheal Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your trachea, or windpipe, is one part of your airway system. Airways are pipes that carry oxygen-rich air to your lungs.

Title: Transient Ischemic Attack
Condensed Summary: A transient ischemic attack (TIA) is a stroke that lasts only a few minutes. It happens when the blood supply to part of the brain is briefly blocked.

Title: Traumatic Brain Injury
Condensed Summary: What is traumatic brain injury (TBI)? Traumatic brain injury (TBI) is a sudden injury that causes damage to the brain.

Title: Traveler's Health
Condensed Summary: Traveling can increase your chances of getting sick. A long flight can increase your risk for deep vein thrombosis.

Title: Tremor
Condensed Summary: What is a tremor? A tremor is a rhythmic shaking movement in one or more parts of your body.

Title: Trichomoniasis
Condensed Summary: Trichomoniasis is a sexually transmitted disease caused by a parasite. It spreads from person to person during sex.

Title: Trigeminal Neuralgia
Condensed Summary: Trigeminal neuralgia (TN) is a type of chronic pain that affects your face. It causes extreme, sudden burning or shock-like pain.

Title: Triglycerides
Condensed Summary: What are triglycerides? Triglycerides are a type of fat.

Title: Tubal Ligation
Condensed Summary: Tubal ligation (getting your "tubes tied") is a type of surgery. It prevents a woman from getting pregnant.

Title: Tuberculosis
Condensed Summary: What is tuberculosis (TB)? Tuberculosis (TB) is a bacterial disease that usually attacks the lungs.

Title: Tuberous Sclerosis
Condensed Summary: Tuberous sclerosis is a rare genetic disease that causes benign tumors to grow in the brain and other organs. Symptoms vary, depending on where the tumors grow.

Title: Tumors and Pregnancy
Condensed Summary: Tumors during pregnancy are rare, but they can happen. Tumors can be either benign or malignant.

Title: Turner Syndrome
Condensed Summary: What is Turner syndrome? Turner syndrome is a genetic disorder that affects a girl's development and appearance.

Title: Twins, Triplets, Multiple Births
Condensed Summary: If you are pregnant with more than one baby, you are far from alone. Multiple births are up in the United States.

Title: Ulcerative Colitis
Also Called: Colitis, Distal colitis, Pancolitis, Ulcerative proctitis
Condensed Summary: Ulcerative colitis (UC) is a disease that causes inflammation and sores, called ulcers, in the lining of the rectum and colon. It is one of a group of diseases called inflammatory bowel disease.

Title: Uncommon Infant and Newborn Problems
Condensed Summary: It can be scary when your baby is sick, especially when it is not an everyday problem like a cold or a fever. You may not know whether the problem is serious or how to treat it.

Title: Underage Drinking
Condensed Summary: Alcohol is the most widely misused substance among America's youth. Drinking by young people has big health and safety risks.

Title: Ureteral Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your kidneys make urine by filtering wastes and extra water from your blood. The urine travels from the kidneys to the bladder in two thin tubes called ureters.

Title: Urethral Disorders
Condensed Summary: The urethra is the tube that allows urine to pass out of the body. In men, it's a long tube that runs through the penis.

Title: Urinalysis
Condensed Summary: A urinalysis is a test of your urine. It is often done to check for a urinary tract infections, kidney problems, or diabetes.

Title: Urinary Incontinence
Condensed Summary: What is urinary incontinence (UI)? Urinary incontinence (UI) is the loss of bladder control, or being unable to control urination.

Title: Urinary Tract Infections
Condensed Summary: The urinary system is the body's drainage system for removing wastes and extra water. It includes two kidneys, two ureters, a bladder, and a urethra.

Title: Urine and Urination
Condensed Summary: Your kidneys make urine by filtering wastes and extra water from your blood. The waste is called urea.

Title: Usher Syndrome
Condensed Summary: Usher syndrome is an inherited disease that causes serious hearing loss and retinitis pigmentosa, an eye disorder that causes your vision to get worse over time. It is the most common condition that affects both hearing and vision.

Title: Uterine Cancer
Condensed Summary: The uterus, or womb, is the place where a baby grows when a women is pregnant. There are different types of uterine cancer.

Title: Uterine Diseases
Condensed Summary: The uterus, or womb, is the place where a baby grows when a woman is pregnant. The first sign of a problem with the uterus may be bleeding between periods or after sex.

Title: Uterine Fibroids
Condensed Summary: Uterine fibroids are the most common benign tumors in women of childbearing age. Fibroids are made of muscle cells and other tissues that grow in and around the wall of the uterus, or womb.

Title: Vaccine Safety
Condensed Summary: What are vaccines? Vaccines play an important role in keeping us healthy.

Title: Vaccines
Condensed Summary: What are vaccines? Vaccines are injections (shots), liquids, pills, or nasal sprays that you take to teach your body's immune system to recognize and defend against harmful germs.

Title: Vaginal Bleeding
Condensed Summary: Menstruation, or period, is a woman's monthly bleeding. Abnormal vaginal bleeding is different from normal menstrual periods.

Title: Vaginal Cancer
Condensed Summary: Vaginal cancer is a rare type of cancer. It is more common in women 60 and older.

Title: Vaginal Diseases
Condensed Summary: Vaginal problems are some of the most common reasons women go to the doctor. They may have symptoms such as: Itching Burning Pain Abnormal bleeding Discharge

Title: Vaginitis
Condensed Summary: What is vaginitis? Vaginitis, also called vulvovaginitis, is an inflammation or infection of the vagina.

Title: Valley Fever
Condensed Summary: Valley Fever is a disease caused by a fungus (or mold) called Coccidioides. The fungi live in the soil of dry areas like the southwestern U.S.

Title: Varicose Veins
Condensed Summary: Varicose veins are swollen, twisted veins that you can see just under the skin. They usually occur in the legs, but also can form in other parts of the body.

Title: Vascular Diseases
Condensed Summary: What are vascular diseases? Your vascular system is your body's network of blood vessels.

Title: Vasculitis
Condensed Summary: Vasculitis is an inflammation of the blood vessels. It happens when the body's immune system attacks the blood vessel by mistake.

Title: Vasectomy
Condensed Summary: A vasectomy is a type of minor surgery that prevents a man from being able to get a woman pregnant. It is a permanent form of birth control.

Title: Veterans and Military Family Health
Condensed Summary: Service members and veterans face some different health issues from civilians. Their families also face some unique challenges.

Title: Veterans and Military Health
Condensed Summary: Military service members and veterans have made sacrifices to our country, and they face different health issues than civilians. During their service, they are at risk for various injuries.

Title: Viral Infections
Condensed Summary: What are viruses? Viruses are very tiny germs.

Title: Vision Impairment and Blindness
Condensed Summary: If you have low vision, eyeglasses, contact lenses, medicine, or surgery may not help. Activities like reading, shopping, cooking, writing, and watching TV may be hard to do.

Title: Vital Signs
Condensed Summary: Your vital signs show how well your body is functioning. They are usually measured at doctor's offices, often as part of a health checkup, or during an emergency room visit.

Title: Vitiligo
Condensed Summary: Vitiligo causes white patches on your skin. It can also affect your eyes, mouth, and nose.

Title: VLDL Cholesterol
Condensed Summary: What is cholesterol? Cholesterol is a waxy, fat-like substance that's found in all the cells in your body.

Title: Voice Disorders
Condensed Summary: Voice is the sound made by air passing from your lungs through your larynx, or voice box. In your larynx are your vocal cords, two bands of muscle that vibrate to make sound.

Title: Von Hippel-Lindau Disease
Condensed Summary: What is Von Hippel-Lindau disease (VHL)? Von Hippel-Lindau disease (VHL) is a rare disease that causes tumors and cysts to grow in your body.

Title: Vulvar Cancer
Condensed Summary: Vulvar cancer is a rare type of cancer. It forms in a woman's external genitals, called the vulva.

Title: Vulvar Disorders
Condensed Summary: The vulva is the external part of a woman's genitals. Some problems you can have with the vulvar area include: Vaginitis or vulvovaginitis, swelling or infection of the vulva and vagina Skin problems due to allergy Vulvar cancer Vulvodynia, or vulvar pain Symptoms may include redness, itching, pain, or cracks in the skin.

Title: Walking Problems
Condensed Summary: What are walking problems? If you are like most people, you walk thousands of steps each day.

Title: Warts
Condensed Summary: Warts are growths on your skin caused by an infection with humanpapilloma virus, or HPV. Types of warts include : Common warts, which often appear on your fingers Plantar warts, which show up on the soles of your feet Genital warts, which are a sexually transmitted disease Flat warts, which appear in places you shave frequently In children, warts often go away on their own.

Title: Water Pollution
Condensed Summary: We all need clean water. People need it to grow crops and to operate factories, and for drinking and recreation.

Title: Weight Loss Surgery
Also Called: Bariatric surgery, Bypass surgery, Gastric banding, Obesity surgery
Condensed Summary: Weight loss surgery helps people with extreme obesity to lose weight. It may be an option if you cannot lose weight through diet and exercise or have serious health problems caused by obesity.

Title: West Nile Virus
Condensed Summary: West Nile virus (WNV) is an infectious disease that first appeared in the United States in 1999. Infected mosquitoes spread the virus that causes it.

Title: Whooping Cough
Condensed Summary: What is whooping cough? Whooping cough, or pertussis, is a respiratory infection that can cause coughing fits.

Title: Wilms Tumor
Condensed Summary: Wilms tumor is a rare type of kidney cancer. It causes a tumor on one or both kidneys.

Title: Wilson Disease
Condensed Summary: Wilson disease is a rare inherited disorder that prevents your body from getting rid of extra copper. You need a small amount of copper from food to stay healthy.

Title: Women's Health
Condensed Summary: Women have unique health issues. And some of the health issues that affect both men and women can affect women differently.

Title: Women's Health Checkup
Condensed Summary: Regular health exams and tests can help find problems before they start. They also can help find problems early, when your chances for treatment are better.

Title: Wounds and Injuries
Condensed Summary: An injury is damage to your body. It is a general term that refers to harm caused by accidents, falls, hits, weapons, and more.

Title: Wrist Injuries and Disorders
Condensed Summary: Your wrist connects your hand to your forearm. It is not one big joint; it has several small joints.

Title: X-Rays
Condensed Summary: X-rays are a type of radiation called electromagnetic waves. X-ray imaging creates pictures of the inside of your body.

Title: Yeast Infections
Condensed Summary: Candida is the scientific name for yeast. It is a fungus that lives almost everywhere, including in your body.

Title: Zika Virus
Condensed Summary: Zika is a virus that is spread mostly by mosquitoes. A pregnant mother can pass it to her baby during pregnancy or around the time of birth.
